text: Bottle. BB 08.2017. Clear mahogany, modest fizzy head. Caramel sweet, a bit of a nettley herbal note, smoked sausages... Sweet and sticky. Dry finish. Not too pleasant, the smoke and sweetness dont mix well IMO, I guess Im just not a fan of old school smoked beers. Would have perhaps liked it more in winter with some greasy sausages and sauerkraut.
Smoky and malty with sweet undernotes. Pours a nice brown with a fast dissipating tan head. Very nice smooth and smokey with an edge in the finish. Very nice.

Butelka 500ml z datą ważności do 09.2017 BARWA: bursztyn, klarowne. PIANA: średnia, jasno beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, niezbyt trwała. AROMAT: karmel w połączeniu nutami melanoidowymi i delikatnym alkoholem do tego wędzonka szynkowa, na skórze wychodzi delikatne żelazo. SMAK: ciemne pieczywo, gorzka czekolada, goryczka ogniskowo-popiołowa. Wędzonka bardzo dobrze balansuje słodką podbudowę, dość pełne z niskim wysyceniem, nie tak pijalne jak marcowe ale dobre.

Bottle. Pours deep amber body, with a pretty thick yet rather rapidly dissipating off-white head. Aroma of intense smoked ham, smoked sausage, bacon, slight notes of malt and wood. Taste is semi-dry; flavors of intense smoked ham/meat, some notes of wooden barrel, malt and ash in the background. Smoked meat and a bit of ash in the finish. Full-bodied, slick texture, low carbonation. Great aroma, balance and mouthfeel. This is what a smoked beer is all about.

BB 09/2107. Poured a translucent (just) coppery-brown with thin light tan dense foam head that diminished quickly to a blotchy cap that laced OK. Carbonation moderate, very slow and medium to coarse. Aroma very strongly of natural open/camp-fire smoked bacon with undertones of sweet malt; alcohol well hidden. Taste initially of very strong open-fire like smoked bacon with sweet roasted caramel and hints of spice; quite sweet and malty; taste not as smoky as aroma; low bitterness; alcohol well hidden. Medium body. Very smooth with a nice sweet with moderately strong smoke on the finish. Nice.
Zapach i smak szynkowy, wędzony, drzewny, kiełbaska z ogniska. Barwa ciemnobursztynowa. Pełne w smaku, mocne.

On draught. Pours a clear mahogany, with a dense tan head that lasts, leaving good lacing. Nose is smoke, dark malt, and band-aids. Taste follows. Very nice balance of smoke and doppelboc sweetness. Very good.

Ar: Campfire smoke, medium-high intensity; toasty malt, with a slight red apple and pineapple fruitiness. Ap: Deep amber, crystal clear; medium tan head with good retention, leaving chunky trails of foam as it subsides, with a solid cap of suds. T: Big toasted malt with an underlying slightly sweet smokiness; richly malty; clean, firm alcohol; sweet-smoke interplay throughout; steely, herbal hop note, with a medium-low bitterness. P: Medium body with high carbonation; finish is medium-dry. O: This beer just screams "refinement"; the smoke and malt flavors are both powerful, but theyre excellently delineated yet complimentary; sweetness and malt richness create a wonderful doppelbock profile throughout.

Kolor: Bordowy, zamglony. Piana: Beżowa, średnio obfita, szybko się dziurawi i zaczyna opadać. Zapach: Wędzona szynka, drewno z ogniska i popiół, trochę karmelu. Smak: Słodowa słodycz, do której dołącza wędzona szynka zostają skontrowane przez delikatną goryczkę. Dobre ciało, niskie wysycenie, dobra pijalność. Nie jestem fanem koźlaków, ale to piwo wypiłem ze smakiem.
Aromat wędzonego sera. Piana ładna, szybko opada. W smaku wędzony ser, oscypek, w tle karmel, drewno.

Kolor miedziany wpadający w burgund, raczej klarowne, wrażenie oleistości piwa. Piana z początku obfita po chwili redukuje się do sporego pierścienia. Drobnopęcherzykowa, "brudnawa" beżowo-żółtawa, ładny lacing. W zapachu dominuje zdecydowanie wędzonka dębowa, szynkowa, bardzo wyrazista, bardzo przyjemna, przebija się nieśmiało karmel, troszeczkę słodkawy, leciutka paloność. Bardzo bogaty i złożony smak/ Dominuje oczywiście wędzonka jednak wyczuwalne melanoidyny i paloność, ewidentnie goryczkowy posmak, niezbyt długi jednak intensywny, nutka alkoholowa, jednak bardzo przyjemna. Czućlekki karmel i suszone owoce. Piwo bardzo pełne, treściwe i mimo że troszeczkę ciężkawe to jednak pijalne.
50cl bottle from beer4u. Appearance is hazy orange copper brown. Head is beige. Medium bitterness. Body is dry. Aroma and flavour is roasted, caramel, smoke, oak, hazelnut, chocolate. So smooth!

Aroma is dominated by bacony roastiness with notes of maltiness and wooden barrel. Deep amber in the glass with thick off-white head. Taste is semi dry with flavor of oak roastiness, a lot of smoked ham with noble, ashy background. Beer is very slick and extremely balanced.
European Beer Swap Tasting #10 o dziwo wydal mi się mniej treściwy niż urbock. mniej gładki. aromat i smak dymu z ogniska świetny. Leciutki karmel. Dobrze ukryte alko. Jest dobrze.
Bottle shared by Bvery, thanks buddy! Dark copper brown pour. Aroma is sick, smoked meat, some malt. Taste lets down a little, very good still. Great smoked beer.
Bottle shared. Slightly murky orange pour with a white head. Gusher. Huge smoke aroma. Jerky. Absolutely wonderful.

1 pint 0.9 oz. bottle. Aroma is like opening a bottle of Liquid Smoke ... its just the scent of pure burned wood. Pours a cloudy, medium amber, with a light tan head that is tight and frothy, and lasts quite a while. Taste is medium sweet with a hint smoke, but I really cant make out any distinct flavors (which is unusual for me). It is medium bodied with a creamy texture. Carbonation is average and the finish is all smoke. Overall, it is an intriguing beer. Although, I do find it a bit too sweet for a smoked beer.

Pours a crystal clear copper color with a light beige, bubbly and fluffy head.

Smoke is huge on the nose - burned wood, stale earth, roasted grains and sweet caramel form an intriguing force, enhanced by a whiff of sea salt. A small dose of dried herbs compliment to the profound malts, establishing a pleasant depth.

Has a medium body with a slightly lower carbonation, which is still able to produce a light effervescence during the finish, countering a green tea hop bitterness. Although the smoke and maltiness are both profound, the mouthfeel remains refreshingly light.

Tastes of a bakers chocolate covered toffee peak, gently entangled into earth, wood bark and a ridiculous amount of sweet and heavy smoke. Turns a little sweeter during mid palate with rock sugars enriching the malts, toned down by dry and herbal hops. Finishes surprisingly bitter with some lingering smoke and a well exhibited rustic malt sweetness.

Huge and intense, but not too heavy or sweet Doppelbock, defined by its well build, smoky maltiness.

Bottle with expiry 05/2017. Copper colour, clear, rocky head that does not stay long. Aroma is bonfire, burned rubber, caramel, a bit of ash. Light bitterness, light sweetness. Soft carbonation, full body, but not cloying. Good, but not exceptional.
Nose is smokey and charcuterie. Dark amber with small head. Taste is oak and smoke with lots of malts as well. Palate is long and smokey leaving very smooth.

it has a very smokey aroma. Appearance has a hazy amber/orange color.light sweetness, medium bitterness, in the taste.medium body, average carbonation, oily feel, overall impression a great tasting smoked beer. Its a bon fire in your mouth.

Pours clear copper, with beige soapy head. Aroma: smoky, ham, bacon, hint of honey, floral hop notes. Flavour: follows aroma, even more intense; ham, smoked bacon, when it warms up, steps forward toffee & caramel like notes, hint of honey and gentle citrusy, floral notes of hops. Finish is slightly dry, bitter. Body is medium to full, texture smooth, carbonation is moderate.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 32A/9A). Bottle 50 cl - Batch LGU (BBF 08/2017). AROMA: predominant medium smoke notes with a slight bacon-like character. low malt notes with Maillard compounds and a slight peppery alcohol note. APPEARANCE: ambar color and clear. medium beige head with good retention. leg formation. TASTE: medium smoky notes with touches of wood, followed by a medium-low slightly sweet malt presence with Maillard compounds (bread crust). medium-low bitterness with a smoky and almost-dry finish. PALATE: medium-full body with medium carbonation. slight alcohol warmth. OVERALL: a smoked Doppelbock with a unbalanced smoked malt, masking the underlying beer.

Pours reddish amber, bit of white foam. Aroma is nice malty and sweetish. Good stuff. Lager comes out, relatively weak body that goes smoothly. Oak, wood and bit of sweet caramel giving spectra character to the beer.

Bottle @ home. Pours a deep copper colored liquid with a medium tan head. Aroma of wood, smoke, dark fruits, ash,mint, caramel, honey, oak. Taste is medium bodied with a rounded sweetness. Flavors of caramel, toffee, smoke, red fruits, plums, dates, herbs , oak. Finish is a bit drier with balanced Spicy bitterness.

Butelka 500ml. Ciemno-miedziany kolor. Piana obfita,lekko zoltawa,pozostaje dosc dlugo. W zapachu wyrazna wedzonka ,ktora niestety tlumi inne zapachy. W smaku takze wedzone nuty sa przewodnimi. Pojawiaja sie jednak slodkie posmaki karmelu lub toffi .i lekkie owocowe tony z suszonych owocow. Niezle piwo o swietnym balansie.

Bottle from SinH4 - thanks for supplying me with the good stuff! Pours a clear reddish brown, with a nice, off-white head. Subtle smoky aroma, fruity, caramel, slightly roasty, perfumy, herbal, more subtle then the Urbock. Medium sweetness, with light bitterness, salt and lingering tartness. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Slightly tart finish. 
Good balance, more subtle than the Urbock, more fruity ethers in the nose.

Zapach intensywny, wędzonka, bekon, szynka, drewno, karmel. Kolor ciemnobursztynowy, klarowne. Piana średnio obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku słodkie, średnia pełnia, wędzonka, bekon, karmel, chleb, drewno. Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie.
Oleiste, pełne piwo. W aromacie i smaku świetna wędzonka. Nie sądziłem, że piwo wędzone może być tak dobre :)

Bottled. 25cl sample. The aroma has wood, bacon smoke, caramel. Copper coloured beer with a medium sized white head. The taste is light bitter and has caramel sweetness, wood tones, oak. Very nice stuff.

Bottle shared at home. Big sweet smoked malts, kale, bacon, jambon, peat, liquid smoke, tobacco, oak, vanilla, resin, caramel, dark honey, sausage and ash, bark, hazelnut. Moderate sweet and bitter. Medium body, soft carbonation. Damn tasty.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Very nice deep reddish amber with small off white head. Smoked sausage, light kale/mash/gravy classic Dutch stampot. Ash, caramel, bacon, lots of campfire. Medium sweet and light bitter. Bit over medium bodied. Yes, its a nice beer but I really just dont get rauchbier and itll never be something I really enjoy. Id enjoy this more without the smoke I think.
Zapach wędzenia/dymu i słodów. W smaku przepyszna wędzonka, drewno i ponownie słody idące w zapasy z wytrawnością od wędzenia. Bardzo bogato, oleiście i pysznie! Niewyczuwalny alkohol.
Barwa bursztynowa, piana niestety słaba. Piękny zapach mięsnej wędzonki, w tle bakalie, słodowość. W smaku gęste, wręcz likierowe. Czuć wysoki balling, ale wcale nie czuć alkoholu. Polecam.
0.5l bottle. Copper color with tanned head. Smoked malt aroma. Taste is smoky with some bitterness. Medium to full body. Overall its excellent beer.

Mahogny. Strong but balanced smoke, sausages, campfire, and caramel malts. Full, sweetish taste that finishes dry, lightly bitter and lightly smoky. Full body, and a smooth texture. Overall, a great doppelbock. Rich, tasty and harmonic. Currently the best smoked beer I have had.

Bottle. Aroma- clear, wooden-ham-like smokiness, with a typical Doppelbock notes- bready and delicate caramel. Copper, perfectly clear, with a ugly, beige, big-bubbled head, which quickly disappears. In the taste, therere some bready notes, combined with raisins and some caramel. Unfortunately, the smokiness is way too low for me. Medium-full-bodied, with a medium carbonation. As a Dopperlbock, its not so bad, but as a smoked one, its quite weak.
Amber color with a white head. Aroma contains some caramel, bacon, smoked sausage. Flavor is very smokey with some bacon and smokey flavors. This is amazing right here. Overall hell yeah

500 ml bottle. 
Aroma is full of smoked, salty meat, such as sausages and ham. Also a bit of sweetness from the malt. 
Taste is more of the same, smoked and salted meat, a hint of sweetness but also a leafy and earthy flavour from the hops. A small presence of alcohol is also there. Well balanced. 

Mouthfeel is fairly light but the flavour has such intensity that it lasts a long time after a sip. Not my favourite from Schlenkerla but very good.

Butelka 500ml. Kolor bursztynowy, klarowny, piana niezbyt mocna ale obecna do końca, lekkie ślady na szkle. Wędzonka, wędzonka mocna boczek z domowej wędzarni, może szynka ale mocno wędzona. Smak to też wędzonka z lekkimi owocami suszonymi i drewnem, goryczka średnia. Bardzo mocna zalegająca wędzonka, lubię to. Świetne piwo.

Bottle from Getrankefeinkost, pours deep mahogany with a fast-settling head and aromas of fire smoke and toasted caramel, plus distant red fruit and lemon. Rich and smooth, with a big malty and sultana sweetness tempered by strong woodsmoke, a touch of drying alcohol and a light peppery bitterness that grows into the aftertaste.

Spory woltaż. Wędzone ogniem/dymem z drewna dębowego. Treściwe. W aromacie liście dębu. Umiarkowana goryczka, nie przytłacza. Barwa jasnobrunatna, bardzo ciemna miedź. Ładna, kultowa pełna butelka. Klasyk, bardzo dobry.

(Aecht Schlenkerla Eiche Doppelbock) Bottle 500ml from SinH4, thanks Stefan! Served into a dimpled mug, ABV 8%
Deep red ruby to faint brown coloured beer, with a clear body, small but thick tan head on top, average retention.
Aroma has lots of peat, smoke, wood, smoked meats.
Taste also of peat, light caramel, wood, smoke, smoked bacon.
Medium body, good carbonation.
Nice one.

Barwa piękna, rubinowa/ciemna miedź, piana niska, opadająca do zera. Aromat wędzonej szynki. Smak słodowy z elementami wedzonki, oczywiście jak zwykle w schlenkerli jest to na drugim planie. Finisz lekko goryczkowy, bardzo fajnie skomponowany.

0,5l bottle. Clear deep copper/ruby colour with medium lasting tan head. Aroma: Smokey roasted ham with salt. A bit lighter than the others but better than the weizen. Taste: Full malty and smokey start, way more smokey than the aroma. Has a quite bitter and smokey mouthfeel. More bitter than the others but not as smooth and creamy. The alcohol is higher and you can feel it in the sip. Medium/full body with medium carbonation. Long quite bitter and a bit dry finish.

Pours caramel red with a medium frothy off white head. Aromas of caramel, smoke, raisins, rye bread, ripe apples. Taste is malty and smoky with marinated fruit notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.
Aroma of smoked cheese and rye bread. Nice body, sweet with balanced bitterness, bready aftertaste, some metallic notes. The smokiness is more in the background. A perfect doppelbock
On tap at HopCat. Aroma was of oak, smoke, and malt balanced with some hops.

Bottled. Pours dark ruby colour with quickly disappearing head. Prominent smoky and slighter sweet notes in aroma and taste with sweet finish. Not too heavy bodied yet isnt that easily drinkable, softly carbonated. A beer to my liking.
Dark reddish brown with a machiatto colored lacing. The aroma is dark fruits, oak, and smoked meat. Not sweet and the alcohol is masked well

Sweet breaded toasty and charred ashy smoked malty aroma and taste, some spicy meaty bite, some sweet caramel backing, smoked malty into the close.

Draft. Strong aroma of smoked ham, some malty bread and grainy notes but smokiness is overwhelming. Very full and thick mouthfeel with heavy smoky taste. Very well balanced sweetness, smokyness and bitterness. Classy!

Pours clear red amber with low off white head
Aromas of caramel, smoke, red fruits, hints of cherries, hints of dried fruits, charcuteries
Taste has a very nice malty caramelly base with notes of sweet fruits, smoked charcuteries, wood and sweet bread
Medium to full bodied with average carbonation, sweet with low bitterness

Piwo w kolorze bursztynowym, piana obfita, niezbyt ładna, ale długo się trzyma, w aromacie słody, bardzo przyjemna, zbilansowana wędzonka, mnie się kojarzy z dobrą szynką, w smaku znacznie mniej wędzonki, nisko-średnia goryczka, pojawia się też alkohol, piwo nie jest przesadnie słodkie. Ciało spore, w ustach oleiste i gładkie, wysycenie średnie. Świetny klasyk, w dobrej cenie, bardzo ułożony i przyjemny w odbiorze.

Bottle. BBE June 2011; Drank June 2011 - Stunning Ruby Red in colour. Very Smokey in both aroma and taste. Much smoother and subtler than the Rauchbier Marzen. Malty; smoke, toasty/roasty malts, caramel. Hoppy; spicy hops. Nicely balanced beer. Sweet smoky malty throughout. Very drinkable. Great stuff. Lovely Smoked Beer! (2011-06-17)
Light ruby, creamy high head. Heavy smoke aroma, taste sweetish, blanked by smoke. Hints of honey and nuts somewhere behind. Balanced, alcoholo is ridiculously well hidden. Unbelievable killer beer!

Bottle 50cl. poured into a lager glass. Smoked meat nose; brilliant medium amber, good two finger tick creamy beige head, half-way lasting, good lacing; smoked aroma, smoked sausage, bacon, smoked ham, wood, caramel notes; taste medium sweet and light bitter, roasty, toffee, wood, retronasal smoke; malty sweetbitter aftertaste, syrupy and spicy notes; full-bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation; very well-balanced, smooth and round.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2017 Bottle.Clear,reddish-amber,thick,ugly,unstable,off head,very little lacing.Aroma definitely smoky,slightly ham and sausage but veering towards sheep cheese, maybe due to using oak wood, bready,malty,nutty,slightly wooden,some fruits,Taste smooth,sweet,thick,slightly roasty,carbonation medium,bitterness perceivable,very well balanced.Aftertaste smoky,malty,bready,grassy,earthy,alcohol well hidden (no aroma) but there is some warming.A really very good,complex beer,another satisfying Schlenkerla  release.
UPDATED: JAN 19, 2017 Amber color, almost red. Aroma: smoked sausage, smoke, bread crust, caramel. Taste: caramel, toasted bread, smoked in the background. Sweet, full. Pleasant and very good.

Butelka 0,5l. Obfita, ładna piana, barwa bursztynowa. Aromat wędzony z mocnymi akcentami koźlakowymi, chleb, karmel. W smaku mniej wędzonki, więcej koźlaka. Posmak wędzony. Delikatne ściąganie na języku.
A great beer with lot of smokyness in the nose but just too sweet in the taste.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours clear yellow with a small white head. Aromas of light smoke, sweet malty, corn, pilsnery yeasty. Taste is sweet malty, light smoked, corn, pilsnery yeasty, dry finish.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2017 Butelka 0.5l (BB 05.2017). Z butelki wydaje się, że wędzonka nie jest tak intensywna choć może to tylko złudzenie i zawodna pamięć, a i piwo jest tuż przed terminem więc mogło nieco stracić na "mocy". Poza tym jest równie dobre jak beczkowe choć oczywiście z beczki odczucie świeżości i mocy wędzonki jest lepsze i wybrałbym beczkę bez zastanowienia. 
Tap (Szynkarnia, Wroclaw). Klarowne o miedzianej barwie. Piana w kolorze żółtobiałym, średniotrwała ale z wyraźnym lacingiem. Wędzonka intensywna o szynkowym charakterze choć pojawia się też delikatna nuta ogniskowa. W smaku goryczkowe od wędzonki, ściągające, lekko taniczne, szczypiące na języku ale bardzo przyjemne tonowane mocną podbudową słodową z nutami malanoidynowymi, lekko słodkimi na finiszu choć piwo ma wyraźnie wytrawny charakter. Jednym słowem klasyka w najlepszym wydaniu.

Pours hazy amber, ivory small head. Aroma light wood smoke, caramel malt. Taste: moderate smoke, some malty sweetness, bitter at the end. Pleasant oily feeling, multi layered taste, full mouthfeel, well balanced.

Bursztynowe, klarowne. Piana beżowa, drobna, obfita. 
W aromacie wyraźna nuta wędzona, ale też sporo słodyczy. Jest trochę karmelowe, ale wędzonka mocna. 
W smaku wytrawne, lekko drewniane. Alkohol nie jest wyczuwalny na wprost ale daje znać o sobie. 
Przyjemna drewniano-alkoholowa goryczka w posmaku. 
Nuty koźlaka stłumione przez wędzoność, ale są wyczuwalne. 
Treściwe, konkretne piwo. 
Kolejne świetne piwo od Brauerei Heller.
Barwa ciemnobursztynowa. Wspaniały aromat wędzony, oscypka, wędzonej szynki, niekiedy czuć słoność. W smaku dość gęste, ponownie z intensywnymi akcentami wędzonymi.

Bottle at Tria. Amber clear thin off white head. Malty smokey, earthy nose. Liquid beef jerky. Very smokey, roasty, but hint of sweetness. Drinkable. Tracy really likes this. Caramel malt profile steps up as you work towards the end.

Flaska. Klar bärnstensfärgad med ett smutsvitt skum. Dofter av rök, karamell och nöt. Smakinslag av rök, malt, karamell, honung och trä. Blir väl sött i längden. Så är jag heller ingen fan av det rök-söta.

(500ml bottle from Systembolaget) Pours clear pale copper with a small beighe head that fades without lace. Aroma of caramel and maple syrup malts, smoked ham, toasty hardwood, vanilla, leafy, citrusy, sweet tea. Flavour is much less aggressively smoky than I expected, medium-sweet malt with light caramel and sweet tea, citrus, soft toasted wood, dry smoky quality, light savoury meat notes, drying into the finish with light bitterness of toasted wood and noble hops. Medium bodied, slick and slightly sticky, with very low carbonation and no alcohol heat. Surprisingly mellow and well-integrated smoke, one of the most drinkable smoked beers Ive had.

Bottle, BB 05.2017 (thanks Santa SinH4!). Pours dark amber-copper with beige head. The head stays for some moments. Aroma is bacony smoke, malt, some bitterness. Flavor is sweet and bitter, malt, smoke, bacon, tar, caramel. Finish is sweet and dry-tar bitter. Alcohol is well covered, just a hint in the finish. Overall: great beer, hoppier and more intense than märzen, but maybe not as balanced.

Piwo o miedzianej barwie, całkowicie klarowne. Piana jest jasnopomarańczowa, średnio obfita, zbudowana ze średniej wielkości oczek, które w dodatku jeszcze rosną, pękają, a piana opada i po kilku chwilach nic po niej nie pozostaje. Aromat? Po pierwszym zaciągnięciu się tuż po odkapslowaniu butelki aż otworzyłem oczy szerzej z wrażenia! Intensywna, bukowa, szynkowo-kiełbasiana dymność jest na pierwszym planie. Coś pięknego dla zwolenników wędzonych piw, tym bardziej, że ta wędzonka jest trwała i nie ulatuje od razu. Pod spodem czuć trochę karmelu, który udanie komponuje się z wędzonką. W smaku również wędzonka wychodzi na pierwszy plan, ale tutaj wtóruje jej wyraźna ziołowa goryczka, jest też nuta przypieczonej skórki od chleba. Wysycenie jest niskie, co najwyżej między niskim a średnim, i dobrze pasuje do tego piwa, sprawia, że przyjemnie się je pije. Alkohol jest dobrze ukryty, niewyczuwalny. Piwo jest treściwe, choć nie gęste. Rauchbock to jeden z moich ulubionych stylów, choć przede wszystkim lubię te, które są bardzo "rauch" i tutaj właśnie z takim mam do czynienia. Prawdziwa gratka dla fanów wyrazistej, charakternej wędzonki, przy okazji klasyk, którego po prostu warto spróbować.

Miedziane, klarowne piwo o średniej pianie. Aromat wybitnie wędzony, oscypek, w tle słodkie od słodu. W smaku gęste, słodkie,wędzone, ziołowe. Goryczka średnia w stronę wysokiej. Ogólnie solidna wędzonka mistrzowsko skontrowana ziołowością i goryczką, pijalne, mi bardzo pasowało.

Amber color, off white head. Smokey sausage and ham in the aroma and a sweet malty background aroma of caramel and bread. Surprisingly sweet taste with a sort of champagne dryness to it (might sound weird and wrong but thats my best explanation at this point). The smokey flavors are definately present in the flavor but less than I expected. It has some saltiness to it besides the sweetness. Very strange taste to me. Takes me some getting used to. Tastes kind of like a cola with smoked salty ham and champagne. Definately original to my palate but have yet to enjoy it. I have to say I like their original rauchbeer much more. I might learn to love this one as well though. Time will tell.
Bottle. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of smoke, bacon, noble German, woody. Taste is rather Smokey, loads of hops and chewy malts. Good stuff.
Kran. Aromat wędzony, karmel. W smaku wysycenie wysokie dosyć, wędzonką, goryczka lekka, słodowe. No jak inaczej może smakować 2xbock wędzony...

Bière ambrée/rousse avec de jolis reflets topaze, transparente et sans aucune mousse résiduelle. Nez comme attendu sur le fumé, le bacon, la charcuterie, le chêne... Lalcool est bien perceptible, en plus dêtre fumés les malts sont bien torréfiés, avec de grosses notes de caramel, de chocolat au lait, de sirop dérable. Difficile cependant de retrouver du fruit, hormis des notes de fruits secs, de raisin, de pruneau... Le nez nest pas extrêmement complexe mais ces arômes de bacon fumé sont une merveille quand on boit cette bière avec du saucisson sec, de la viande des grisons etc. La carbonatation est assez faible, la texture huileuse et lalcool bien soutenu malgré un 8% plutôt modeste. Bonne amertume avec le côté fumé, pointe de sécheresse au palais plutôt agréable et bien équilibré. Lalcool est liquoreux et soutient bien lensemble. Les bouches suivantes sont plus douces, dans les sucres, les malts et le côté vineux. La fumé masque beaucoup darômes et de saveurs mais on sent derrière que la base brassicole est très bonne. On retrouve les notes de raisin et de pruneau, mais aussi de liqueur de poire. Le final est profond, la fumé faisant son office pendant de très longues secondes, avec des grosses notes de tabac, de bois résineux, de terre et de cuir, un peu à la manière dun whisky tourbé. Evidemment, les bières fumées sont réservées aux amateurs du genre mais cette Aecht Schlenkerla Eiche Doppelbock en est sans doute un des meilleurs ambassadeurs. Je la recommande très vivement, surtout quand on la déguste avec un bon saucisson sec, cest un régal ! Bouteille 50cl, Boissons du Monde, Saint-Égrève.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Aecht Schlenkerla Eiche - Doppelbock by Schlenkerla ("Heller-Bräu" Trum) at PowiśleFajna ta wedzonka debowa, nie przykrywa wszystkiego, czuc melainydowy charakter piwa, nieco owocow ciemnych, kompotowych. Ciezkie. NajsOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Piwo jest klarowne, barwy bursztynowej, z puszystą, utrzymującą się pianą. Cudowny aromat wędzonki, drewna, karmelu, delikatnie czuć suszone owoce. W smaku wędzona szynka, karmel, posmak chlebowy i suszone owoce. Jestem wielkim fanem schlenkerli i to piwo spełniło moje oczekiwania :).
Flaska systembolaget. Bärnstensfärgad vätska. Doft av charkuterier, trä, enris och rök. Maltig smak med återigen charkuterier och fat. Välbalanserad med träig och kådaliknande avslutning.

SB beställning, flaska. Fantastiskt lyckad doppelbock. Som gjord för julmat. Vacker bärnstensfärg med fint vitt skum. Som alltid en svag ton av rauch i botten. Perfekt balans. Alkoholen totalt gömd. Hur gör dom ? Julaftonsöl 2016. Sofia tittar på sejdeln....
Deep amber color with thin head. Aroma has smoke and wood. Taste is perfectly balanced smoky notes with bitterness and sweety malt. Bock does not get better than this.
Amber clear body and a white creamy head. Clearly smell of smoke, and heavy aroma of smoke, nice. Aroma of caramel and citrus.The taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter. Sticky oily texture.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2016 Bel. Colore ambra scuro, buona Carbonazione. Aroma pieno di affumicatura (quercia), al palato morbida, lunga con una morbidezza che la rende super beverina. Alcol si avverte poco. Affumicata che può essere perfettamente abbinata a tanti cibi.

Mahagonifarben, klar mit hellem Schaum. In der Nase tritt zunächst der Eichenrauch in den Vordergrund, bevor sich süßes Malz und Karamell zeigen. Geschmacklich ist der Rauch auch direkt präsent, aber zurückhaltender und milder als beim Märzen. Die malzig karamellige Note spielt den Gegenpart. Das Ergebnis ist ein wunderbar harmonisches Bier. Empfehlung!
500ml bottle. Aroma is smoke and sweet cough drops .Taste is medium sweet, lightly bitter with a noticeable savoury quality. Excellent.

(bottle)
Aroma:smoked malt ,caramel,slighlty boozy
Appearance:dark amber color,quickly dissapearing head.
Taste:sweet,flavour of smokiness,caramel,toased malt and bread,sweet smokey malty finish.
Palate;medium body,lot to medium carbonation.
Overall:Very nice rich smokey brew.

50cl bottle @Triskel, Llanes. 26-01-2015.
BBD: 08-2015.
Pours quite clear copper with nice off white head. Short head retention, poor lacing. Smoky aromas, difficult to identify anything elese. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is smooth, smoked, some malty sweetness, wood. Quite well balnced, enjoyable.

Bottle. Clear amber color, off-white head with slights lacings. Aroma is smoke, woody, tea scent. In the back a bit of caramel, malts. Taste is smoky, woody, fine malty bready notes paired with slight bitterness. Alcohol is well hidden. Medium body, fairly high carbo. Smooth and flavourful.
500ml bottle. Dark amber body with a medium head. Smoke, caramel, smoked meat, dark fruits

Smoked meats, berry fruits, ashy, alcohol, slightly grassy.
Deep copper colour, medium beige head, lacing.
Heavy smoke, noticably sweet, salty, lightly bitter, fruit, Smoked meat, coffee and ash, ABV well integrated.
Fullbodied, oily feel, soft carbonation, smokey finish.

On tap at brewery. Pours a very dark Amber color with white head. Aroma is filled with BBQ bacon and smoke but also the oak notes of scotch. Taste is heavy and alcohol is noticeable but well balanced. As you continue drinking the complexity brings out dark fruit, earthyand peat notes. An amazing smoked beer!
Wyśmienite piwo. Świetny smak i aromat wędzonej szynki. Miło spędzony czas. Polecam!

Intense dark red, still clear. Average and pretty head, the slightest off-white, shows nice retention and lacing. Strong and persistent aroma of smoked malts (smoked ham, wood) plus a hint of caramel. Taste is pretty sweet with caramel malts and some nice kind of fat feel, nicely backed up and balanced by smoked notes (bacon, smoked salmon). Maybe some dark fruit hints. Slightly warming. Medium body, light crispness, very smooth and easy despite high abv. In my humble opinion this is less complex and interesting than other schlenkerlas, but its still clean and highly satisfying.

500ml bottle from Beer Square. Pours a clear reddish brown, chestnut color with a medium off-white head that diminishes quickly but laces in a pretty way. Aroma is remarkably balanced with notes of smoked ham, Lapsang Souchong tea, beechwood, oak wood, vanilla and an exquisite counterbalance of caramel. Interesting development of the smokiness and malt aromas. Taste is delightful with the permanent non-invasive smokiness, and very subtle caramel, honey, vanilla, dark tea and many varieties of nut flavors. Slightly sweet and the smoke and tar touches. Truly a gem. Relatively light bodied, not boozy at all for an 8% ABV, incredible balance and drinkability. Carbonation is present but not overwhelming. Fantastic aftertaste of smoke. Give me a thousand of these.

500ml bottle @ Chez Sophie. Pours a clear deep amber, frothy off-white head. Aroma is strong smoked malts, taste continues with smooth deep dark smoky malt flavours. Lovely rauchbier but would have to do a side-by-side tasting with the marzen to be able to tell the differences.

Hel klar, brun bärnsten, smuts brunt skum. Stark 3:a. Doft: Rök, frisk höst luft, svagt svagt tjära, växter, rökt korv. Mild fräscht doft, mycket stark 7:a. Smak: Som doft + "ek sötma", annan "söt tjärig" smak jämfört med "orginalet", alkohol.

Aromat karmelu, spieczonej skórki chleba i wędzonki, drewniano szynkowej. W tle lekki alkohol. W smaku lepiej, body potężne słodowo-chlebowe, lekko szynkowa wędzonka i alkoholowe grzanie. Bardzo dobre piwo, prawdopodobnie rozwinie skrzydła wraz z leżakowaniem. Warto kupić więcej niż butelkę.

Cristal clear beer. Amber color, Slightly off-white head, not very persistent, nice lacing. Aroma is mesmerizing. Smoky, wooden, smoked chees, fire place. In the back a bit of caramel, malts. Beautiful. Taste is amazing as well. Same smoky, curing smoke, wood, fire place, camp fire notes. Its so full of flavours, so rich. Alcohol is obviously perfectly covered. Not very full in the mouth and a bit over carbonated for my taste, but still very smooth, super pleasant. Love it.

Ive always eyed this at BOTW but put it down as Smoked is not a prime style for me. But it is German and it does say doppelbock, my favorite style so decided to try it when I saw it at Consumer NF. Pretty decent looking, clear copper, nice lace pattern, spotted sparse and artsy, Smoky flavors hide the dark fruit a bit in the nose, it comes out a bit more in the palate, which is dry and complex.
Not really in line with the high ratings of others but the smokey taste is too much for me.

Dense head over dark amber clear brew.aroma of smoked ham and oak smoke with some dark fruits. Smoke and wood is about the taste. Some sweetness, but medium body, some alcphol, tanine, wooden and bitter finish. Great

Looks awesome: clear red with big, long lasting head. Aroma: oak smoke and caramel, also some fruitiness. Heavy sweetness, full body, medium to low bitterness. Flavour: lots of smoked malts but also fruity sweetness. Nicely hidden alcohol.

Bottle. Clear deep mahogany liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of smoke, raw sugar, bonfire, sausage, toffee, oak and dried fruit. Taste is light to medium sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of raw sugar, smoke and wood. Full bodied with medium carbonation. Awesome stuff. Great complexity while still elegant. Sweet but not overly sticky. Yum.

Pours a bourbon color with an eggshell colored head. Smoky BBQ nose. Flavor is the same. Some sweetness to seem like a bit of brown sugar in the BBQ rub. Tasty. Healthy, slick, and mildly prickly mouthfeel.

Bottle acquired as part of a 2015 Christmas present from the aunt. The smoky aroma hits you right away bringing to mind a hearty fire outdoors with a consistent smoke wafting towards you. Also smells a little bit like a charcoal grilled hot dog. Nice light tan head sitting atop a mahogany colored beer. The taste continues the smoke-filled journey with elements of smoked meats leading the way. There does seem to be some caramel and dark fruit characteristics underneath but the smoke suppresses them from becoming prominent players. The mouthfeel is actually pretty well done with slightly sticky tendency. I respect the effort although its definitely not my style. Ill be tasting the smoke characteristics for a very long time.

Vackert kopparfärgad. I doften finns massor av charkuterier och tjära ovanpå en fin maltighet. Stor smak med fina toner av charkuterier och tjära inbäddade i en fyllig maltighet. En riktigt fin rauchbier.

Åter igen ett fall som ska bedömas med en annan måttstock än den vanliga medelmåttigt kalibrerade IPA-linjalen. Aromen är konstigt nog inte rökig utan snarare som tagen direkt ur ett båthus full med tjärade ekor. Smaken är lite snällare. En för ovanlighetens skull mild rökighet med tydliga drag åt porter. Rimligt drickbar även för rökporterskeptiker.
Extremely smoky aroma. Like tar. When it comes to the taste it becomes too much. Interesting style for sure but not that well tasting. Dark redbrown beer with little head.

500 ml bottle from Systembolaget. APPEARANCE: clear dark amber with a medium off-white head. NOSE: moderate malty aroma of bread, caramel, dried fruits, smoke. TASTE: moderately sweet and moderately bitter. MOUTH: medium body, with lightly sticky textre.

Pleasant sweet aroma of smoke and wood together with maltiness and caramel. Pours ruby with a large head. Fairly decent retention. In taste the smokiness is much more intense than in the aroma, similar to cured meat. Afterwards its sweet, creamy maltiness, slightly bready, witha bit of roast/caramel. I can also feel prunes and some tobacco/ash. It ends with a well fitting mild "noble" bitterness. Leaves great malty aftertaste. Full body, smooth and oily, moderate carbonation and drinkability. Savory and delicious.
Bottle; pours cloudy amber with a beige head; aroma of smoke, ham, and a hint of caramel; taste is smoky with some ham and caramel notes; finish bitter with some smoke and caramel hints; very good
Brown/copper color, large brown head. Aromas of smoked meat, salt, leather and wood. Taste of smoked meat, butter, oak and caramel.
Rödbrun klar med en del skum. Luktar rök, sött. Smakar rök, torv. Helt ok. Lite söt.

Ash tray aroma. Clear Amber colour poor head and lacing. Stale smokey flavour. Flat palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, aska, torv, brunt socker, kolaremmar, ljus torkad frukt, tobak, övermogna röda äpplen, vita russin, charkuterier och trä. Rund och len, rena smaker, lagom sötma, bra balans, fin beska. Riktigt, riktigt gott!

500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Deep mahogany, medium size, pale brown-white head, good lacing. Smoky aroma, tobacco, ash, cured meats, salami and caramel. Full-bodied, mild carbonated, creamy and soft mouthfeel. Smoky and sweet malty taste, caramel, bread, oak, ash and tobacco. Finishing with a mild resinous and woody bitterness.
Bottle Bierkoning Amsterdam bb 10/2017 Clear redbrown colour Aroma Oak Smoke Leather Raisins What a mouthful but balanced Taste of Bamberg smoked Malts some sweet and nice hops Great!
Aus der Flasche bei Kaspar Schulz getrunken. Der ultimative Rauchbock. Geht es besser?
Bottled. Deep brown red body, big beige head. The aroma is sweet and sticky, like a highland whisky. The taste is great, full body with prunes and smoke.

Dark, rich, semi-opaque/cloudy brown with a medium white head. On the nose: immediately bacon jumps out followed by a strong scent of honey-glazed ham, smoky/toasty malts, and certainly some oak. Starts off slightly sweet & smoky and moves onto a savory flavor just like a bite of honey-glazed ham. The mid-palate also has some creamy malts and hops as well. The finish is where you get the oak smoke and a tiny bit of alcohol showing. The smoke & ham flavors faintly stay on your tongue even after a few minutes between sips. When it warms up, the aroma is sweeter...like brown sugar and dark fruits. There are some tosted nuts, sugary sweetness, and cacao flavors that stand out, too. It becomes generally sweeter and creamier as it warms up, holding back the savory and smoky parts for the finish. The complex flavors are maintained throughout the drinking session. Very full-bodied with a very dry finish. Medium carb; smooth & warming. Ultimately, this beer is uniquely savory; like other beers from Schlenkerla, this ones pretty much a BBQ in a glass. With that said, though, this beer is absolutely deliciousI enjoyed it more and more with each sip and could barely put it down to write my thoughts. If youve tried one of their rauchbier before, then expect the same savory, smoky goodness from this doppelbock.

500 ml bottle from Mile High Wine & Spirits fro $5.99. Reddish amber and clear appearance with a small tan head. Aroma of smoked malts, oak, light caramel, light nutty malts and light noble hops. Similar flavor, rich, moderately sweet and mildly bitter with a lingering smoked oak finish. Medium plus body with a smooth, creamy feel. A classic.

500 ml bottle from Woodmans in Janesville, WI, served at cellar temp in a Unibroue glass. Hazy copper, medium diminishing head, faint lacing, a bit of white cap remains throughout...typically wonderful strong smoky Schlenkerla nose, smoked meat and cheese, caramel malts; theres also a bit of a baked apple thing going on here...on the tongue its huge, massive malt character and to my taste a perfectly judged sweetness that doesnt ever become cloying, with a drying toasty-smoky attitude that comes in strongly and quickly, and yes, some actual hops noticeable right at the end, which is bitter and toasty in perfect proportion, with just a tiny hint of sharp, alcoholic apple cider trying to reach up throughout but remaining quite nearly out of sight and palate; extraordinary...on the palate, full and warming with well captured natural-feeling carbonation. This doesnt quite hit the heights of the Urbock for me (well, the Urbock of a decade ago; a re-visit is probably in order), but its still quite excellent in its own right and Im loathe to knock it much for small flaws when it remains a superb example of the style.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2016 Tap. Pours clear Amber, small beige head, decent lacing. Aroma is mega smoke, bonfire, forest fire. Flavor is heavy smoke, light sweet, medium bitter, malty toffee undertones. Medium body. Kinda harsh on the finish, bitter and a bit acidic.Earlier Rating: 6/11/2012 Total Score: 3.8Bottle. Pours clear amber with a small off-white head that disappears almost immediately with little lacing. Aroma is heavily smoky, almost meaty, like a BBQ oak smoker in operation. Smokiness gradually fades after pour, revealing roasted malts and a bit of alcohol. Taste is a bit less smoky than the nose, but still dominated by roasted malts and smoke, with a warming, mildly bitter finish. Nice beer, if a bit watery.
Final score is an average of these rates.
Notes of smoked ham, burnt bread, wood, and oil with some faint brown sugar. Nice carbonated mouthfeel. Fun to try but really hard to drink a significant quantity of.

Not all Aecht Schlenkerla beers are smokey, but this was is. You can smell it from a foot away. The base is a sweet doppelbock. not a heavy, syrupy one, but a moderate one that balances out the smoke. Goes down very easily.
Dark, copper, clear yellowish foam, that dosnt last. Birch smoke, sour wet horse and alcohol in the aroma. Sweet, caramel, with smoke alcohol in the aftertase. High in carbon.
On tap at Salón piva 09/2016, Bratislava, Slovakia. Pours amber color, white head. Aroma of ham, sousage, malty. Taste is sweet, smoked, ham, beef, caramel. Smoked finish.

Bottle 0.5l. Clear reddish brown body, medium yellow head. Aroma of smoke, wood, lapsang tea. Taste is sweet and bitter. Malts, caramel, apples, wood, fruits. And smoke which dominates and perfectly balances all the flavors. Full body, medium carbonation. Alcohol is greatly hidden. Really nice smoked dopplebock!
Bottle 0.5l. Almost clear, reddish amber colored. AROMA- smoky, some berries, strawberries. FLAVOR- slightly sweet, moderately bitter, smoky, berries, strawberries. Fuller bodied. Really good.

Clear dark coppery to brown body, no head. There might be lack of carbonation caused by drinking it month after expiration date. Lovely bacony aroma, dried meat. Taste is mild chocolate, bit of caramel, lots of smoke, sausages and bacon. Full bodied, creamy and oily, flat carbonation. Long sweet smoked finish. Great brew. //bottle from Pivoteka
Light brown pour with a slight off white head. Really great bacon smoked nose on this. Really nice malty and caramel malt taste with much more mild oak smoke character. Really a delicious beer.

- rauchig-torfiger Geruch gepaart mit einer leichten Süße
- leichter runder Geschmack 
- relativ wenig Kohlensäure
- höherer Alkoholgehalt schmeckt man kaum durch
- im Abgang gewinnt die Süße dann etwas die Oberhand
- mitten drin fehlt einfach der Körper, die Besonderheit
- das Bier plätschert etwas ausdruckslos dahin 
Fazit: Diese Schlenkerla Biere sind m. E. überschätzt

16.9 oz. bottle. Pours a clear deep amber with a light beige head. Aroma of campfire (dominant) and malt in the background. Taste is smoke, charcoal, malty sweetness, caramel, and oak. Smoke is not overpowering. Mild bitterness. Medium-bodied. All of the elements come together quite nicely.
Halve literfles gekocht in Berlijn. Roodbruine kleur. Ruikt naar gerookt spek, lekker. Smaakt vrij zoet met een licht bittere afdronk, gerookt spek, volle smaak. Lekker bier.

Kirkas, keskiruskea selvästi punertava olut pienellä ja nopeasti häviävällä vaahdolla, joka ei jätä pitsiä lainkaan. Tuoksu vahvasti savuinen, tamminen ja makean karamellinen sekä hieman hedelmäinen. Maku vahvasti, mutta kuitenkin pehmeästi savuinen. Savuisuuden ohella kivasti tanssia lyö maltaisen karamellinen makeus ja toffeisuus. Taustalta löytyy lisäksi hedelmää ja myös aavistus happamuutta. Alkoholi nousee hieman esiin loppumaussa. Melko pehmeä, täyteläinen ja matalahiilihappoinen monimuotoinen kokonaisuus.
500mL bottle. Pours a dark amber with a barely-there white head. Smoky aroma of gouda, bacon, and malt. Lightly smoky taste with malty sweetness. Smooth finish. Well-balanced, full-mouthfeel.
Bottle at hopaholic. Red colour small brown head. Nose is definitve but light smoke. Taste is also smoky, but very well balanced with the sweetness of the malt. Full mouhfeel. A smoked masterpiece.

Közepes, rendkívül tartós hab, vörös szín. Füstölt sonkás illat. Íze intenzív, füstölt malátás, a füstölés nincs túlzásba víve, ott a maláta is, a háttérben egy kis karamell is érezhető. Hosszú, kellemes, füstölt malátás utóíz. Nagyon fincsi, a sült nyuszira meg egyenesen tökéletes. Testes, de nem nehéz. Sajna ahogy melegszik, előbukkan az alkohol is, de nem tolakodóan.

500ml bottle at Josh. Vintage 2013. Aroma is sweet, slightly smoke. Same fruity, winey taste. Similar to barleywines. Pleasant, but almost not already smoked. 

Vintage 2010 same day. Surpisingly smoked aroma. Taste is sweet with some smoky notes. Definitely not a good beer for aging, which becomes more winey, than smoky.

Appearance: hazy medium amber with one finger of creamy ivory head, excellent retention and moderate lacing. (4/5) Aroma: hardwood smoke, dark fruit, caramel malt. (8/10) Taste: moderate smoke, moderate sweet, mild bitter. (8/10) Medium body, moderate carbonation, off-dry smoky finish. (4/5)

A couple of weeks ago, I said that the Aecht Schlenkerla Fastenbier might be an excellent place for neophytes to begin exploring Rauchbiers, given its overall quite mellow character. Well, thats still true, but this one might be an even better first Rauchbier. The oak smoke seems milder than the beech smoke, and its also slightly less evocative of smoked-cured meat. Not radically different than the Fastenbier, but just as good - and, interestingly, the much higher ABV is really not any more apparent than the much lower (5.5%) of the Fastenbier. (16/20)
Poured a red color with a white head. Aroma waslots of smoke, caramel, dark fruit. Flavor similar, complex.liquid smoke.
Легкая копчено& слабый алкогол& чистый вкус

Copper to ruby colour, opaque. Tall dense off-white head. Good retention. Thick lacing. Aroma of smoke, smoked cheese, candy sugar. Medium body. Oily. Multi-layered flavour. Moderately smoked. Brandy. Caramel. Toasted malts. Dried fruit. Alco very well hidden. Light soft bitterness. Hoppy aftertaste. Splendid. Thanks YantarCoast for the opportunity.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
2010  A: Brown with some red notes, light off white lacing. N: Smoke, tar, oak T: Smokey! Tar, hints of raisins, plum O: Very smoke with some light sweetness to it. Lovely!!

July 14, 2016. Bottle, vintage 2010qa, shared by rlgk, thanks! 
Lugjt hazy amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is lots of smoked meat, wood, some malty toffee and dark bread notes, hints of prunes and figs. Taste is medium sweet, malty, light smoked, very soft bitter. Finish is smooth and sweet malty, some smoked meat and burnt wood. Medium to full bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation. 
Smokey aroma with a very nice and smooth maltbase.

500 ml. is a bit of a slow gusher settling to a deep copper with a lasting film of bubbles. Nose is smoke, meat, brown sugar and leftover campfire. Flavors of bacon, caramel and char. Medium body has low-medium carbonation and an excellent balance. Awesome smoked, but its third in line behind a couple of other Aecht Schlenkerla brews.
Brews n chews. Copper colored pour. White head. Aromas of campfire smoke. Slight bitterness.

16.9 ounce bottle. Pours a ruby bronze with a thine beige head. Taste is of smoke, fruit, roasted malt, caramel and some hops. Smoke and malt aroma. Has a full, creamy body. Overall, quite excellent. To me these beers are amazing examples of their styles, but the smoke is well integrated and bolsters a good beer.

Aroma: big smoke and sweet malt
App: clear tea amber, off white head with sudsy lacing
Flavour: smoke, clean crystal sweet malt
Palate: Long smoke and balancing bitterness

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a clear coppery brown with a medium head of off white foam. Nice smoky oak aroma. Very smooth with lots of smoky flavor. Tastes better than the Marzen that uses Beechwood. Very enjoyable.

Light clear copper with little light brown head. Aroma is smoke and also a little fish and ham. Taste is more smoke, quite bitter and also malty sweetness and booze. Oily mouthfeel but also some pretty sour carbonation. Finish is very boozy, warm but fitting well. Overall interesting and well rounded. The meat/fish didnt shock me as hard as with the schlenkerla fastenbier but I wouldnt say I enjoyed it.

Bottle from Geers, Gent - BE. Color: dark brown beer with small carbonation with medium brown head. Smell: smoked malt. Smoked ham taste. Very intensive and really drinkable. Superb smoked beer. Good attenuation. Oak notes. Aftertaste: oak notes. Smoked oak and smoked jam. Very intensive. Amazing.

Bottle. Smoked ham aroma. Pours dark bronze in colour with a very large frothy head. Largely smoked flavour with notes of bacon & cheese. Some notes of toffee and caramel and also some hoppy bitterness. Thick and creamy texture. Long smoked finish. Excellent.

Mit der Zeit habe ich mich sogar an diese Rauchbiere nicht nur gewöhnt, nein, eigentlich sind sie gar nicht mal so schlecht. Der Rauch an sich nebst dem Lachs vergeht nach drei Schlücken wieder, aber was bleibt ist die feine Würze, eine leichte Süße, Malzigkeit und eine erstaunliche Süffigkeit. Ich bin positiv überrascht und befürchte, ich werde noch mal zum Fan.

From a 500ml bottle on 15/5/2016. Pours a clear light amber with a biggish head. Has a pleasant light smoked aroma with a bit of bacon in the mix. Flavour wise, its got lots of caramel and toffee malt and a hint of dark sweet fruit, but its the big smokey bitterness that ultimately holds sway here. The hops are quite pronounced and linger in a most satisfying manner. Full bodied, with a thickish texture and modest carbonation. Damn this is good - rich, complex unusual and most importantly, delicious. Certainly one of the best smoked beers Ive ever had.

Od dzisiaj jestem fanem piw wedzono-dymionych. Tutaj wplyw ma drewno debowe. Piana gruboziarnista. Czuc delikatnie wedzona szynke i taki fajny zapach dymu z ogniska w lesie. Jest rowniez bardzo slodowo jak to w Kozlaku. Rownie intensywne odczucie w smaku. Kolor ciemny miedziany. Piwo klarowne. Musze sprobowac ich innych "wyrobow".

Bottle. Nose is smoke wood, smoked cheese, savory, meats. Taste is malty, cheese, gentle smoke, meats, toffee, gentle pine, berry, ash, hint of salt. 

A delicious filling beer.
Bottle, bb 6/2016. Pours copper, clear, with white head. Aroma of smoked malts, a bit of caramel. Moderately sweet, with distinct smoky aftertaste. Medium bodied, with perfectly hidden alcohol.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2016 Smoked fish aroma is dominant, but not heavy. Nice clear copper colour, small beige top. Caramelized herring, weeds, minerals. Some saltiness, medium bitterness, slightly dry. Doppelbock is one of my favorite types of beer and smoky beers are not so much - but I have only good words for this one. Great mouthfeel, excellent in alcohol. A lot of malt, piece of art!

Flasche - Kuperfarben, rotstichig, geringe Schaumkrone, klar. Typisch intensive Schinkenaromen, viel Malz. Trockener Abgang. Ein bisschen edgy finde ich, viel Alkohol, nicht richtig harmonisch eingebunden. Geht nicht leicht runter. Dennoch wunderbarer Geschmack.

From 0.5L bottle; pours dark amber, slightly reddish coloured, nearly clear with some large, floating particles and a light brown head. Aroma: smoke, malts, slightly caramel; taste: slightly smoky flavor, slightly sweet, leading to a light bitter, smoky finish. Very pleasant aroma! Not as heavy smoky as most of the Schlenkerla beers. Medium to full body, creamy texture.
Pours copper. Aroma: smoke, dark malt. Taste: smoky and complex with some chocolate and raisins.

Old rating rerated 23.04.2016, 0,5l bottle shared at local tasting:
Nice slightly bubbly-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry and mild smoked, shed, smoked malts, caramel, minerals, grass, oak, bark, weeds, nuts. Taste is slightly dry mineraly, weeds, smoked malts, hay, grass, minerals, caramel, nuts, oak. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.
Taste at The Paisley Beer Festival. A light golden colour. A bit of a head. Very smokey.
Keg at Paisley beer festival 2016.... Copper. Thin white lacing... Big sweet soft smoke nose. Big smoke... Sweet toffee malts. Soft toffee fruit.. Long smokey malts

Bottle. Pours a clear brown with a medium offwhite top. Complex aroma with smoke, dates, wood and malts. Vinous fruityness. Light bitter flavor with smoke, cured meat and lightly roasted malts. Medium-full body. Finishes with a little warmth and a clean bitterness. Avg co2 levels.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2016 Bottle 500ml. Served at cellar temperature. Pours clear amber. Head is off-white, good sized and lasts well. Aroma is smokey with notes of salty pancetta, caramel, toasted wood chips, peat and hints of berries. Flavour is very smooth with a light roasted bitterness, toasted grains, smokey wood chips, smoked/cured meats, caramel, hints of berries, a touch of aniseed and a salty finish. Medium bodied with medium carbonation and a long finish.
Bottle in Florida. Purchased room temp. Chilled in fridge. Smells like smoked ham. Smoked meat flavor with definite sweetness. Can taste malt. Very good overall. One of best smoked beers Ive had

Bottle
Pours deep carmel copper hue with a nice eggshel head with very good lacing. big smokey nose with lots of wood. Flavors are smokey up front followed by nice doppelbock sweet malt and long into the finish. The Finish is both half smokey and half sweet malt. Body is big lush and quite slick. carbonation is mild. Very solid smoked beer here. Glad this is available locally.

Bottle. Tan, with thin cream head and medium lacing. Massive smokey bacon aroma. Delicious aromas of caramel malt, gentle smoke and bacon, sweet finish. Great mouth feel. Fantastic beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Dark reddish brown body with white head. Aroma is smoke with malts. Taste is also smoke, caramel. Aftertaste is sweet malts with nice bitterness in the background.

500ml bottle into a Samuel Smith nonic. Paler brown color and a mild smoky aroma. This beer answers the age old question Is there any difference between beech smoking malt and oak smoked malt? Yes, Virginia, there is. This is a much less pronounced smokiness, both in aroma and flavor, as well as a less pronounced meatiness to the beer. Im detecting a slightly burnt, ashy flavor to this one. Ill have to say that I prefer the fuller flavored Urbock from this brewery.
Wow. This is the best smoked beer Ive ever had. Smells like bacon. Tastes of smoked meats. Very smooth.
Klares Bernstein mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, rauchig, reichlich Speck, süß, Karamell, Holzaromen, weich, sehr würzig.

Amber colored body, with weak head. Aroma is smoke, mlata, burnt sugar and malts. Palate is thick and little oily, and has low to medium carbonation. Taste is malty, sweetish and smoky obviously. Finish is sweet, with little warming sensation fron ABV. Overall original in taste , but could be more comples, now being regular dobbelbock with smoked flavour.

$5.29 bottle from Wine Warehouse.

Pours amber with a small beige head. 

Aroma of deep smoke, rubber, earth, toast, ham.

Taste is bittersweet smoked ham juices, earth, leaves, caramel. Tasty!!!

Tap @ Fermentoren. Pours bronze with a beige head. I will go ahead and be honest. I hate smoked beers like this. So if you like smoked beers. Dont look at this rating. The aroma has lots of smoked meat of all kinds, woolen sweaters, dirty robes and ash. Some sweet malts in the back as well. The taste is... smokey with lots of smoked meats, ash, sweet malts, grainy notes and woolen sweaters.

Clear, deep amber-ruby colored, medium- off white head. Aroma is some malt and caramel but mostly strong smoked ham and some toast. Taste is medium sweet malt, caramel, moderate to strong smoked ham, some toasted malt, campfire, medium herbal bitterness, semidry finish. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, creamy. Definitely my favorite Rauchbier.

De notas más dulces y delicadas que la mítica rauchbier märzen de la casa. El ahumado de roble es más fino, se va desarrollando según avanzas cada trago. Un final levemente seco. Alcohol muy bien integrado.

Draught at Pigalle. Damn these guys are Rauchbier wizards, this brew has a massive BBQ character, almost feels like a liquid pulled pork sandwich, also reminiscent of wooden-oven pizza. A great smokey brew to be enjoyed slowly as it hides the abv pretty well.

Draft. Nose is super smokey and earthy. Modest green wood character. Deep reed with off white head. Taste follows with a green wood presence and a huge malt backbone. Not overly smokey but a great woody presence throughout.

Could have sworn I had already rated this.... Bottle from Bitter Virtue, Southampton. It pours rich deep red - brown with a thick, foamy white head. The nose is rich, oily, big smoked character, smoked meats, honey glazed ham and smoked bacon fries. The taste is crisp, big, rich smoked action, bitter - sweet, earthy, charred wood, toffee, smoked meats, touch of spice, smoked oily essence and fruit cake with a dry finish. Medium body and fine, foamy carbonation. Quite intense, but a truly great smoked beer.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Clear copper pour with a frothy off white head. Notes of camp fire, sweet malts, some herbal notes, smoke, ash and light bacon.

0,5l fles bij bierkoning vandaan gedeeld met niko. Mahonie klei met een crème kraag aroma en smaak worden gedomineerd die de rook maar op een prettige manier daarnaast ook nog de smaak van gedroogd fruit en caramel. Erg lekker met een mooie volle Body

Nose is of dog food and bacon bits. Taste is oaky, smoky, and meaty. Don't let this review think this beer is bad. Definitely a good beer overall and absolutely worth trying, but difficult to drink more than one.

Color rubino con riflessi dorati, limpida, schiuma bianca poco persistente.
Forte aroma affumicato che ricorda lo speck, legno e amaro affumicato, maltata ed erbacea.
Al palato l'affumicato sovrasta tutto il resto, coda amara "di bruciato", crosta di pane ed erbaceo finale misto a tostato.
Corpo medio-pieno, poco carbonata.

Pours a vibrant ruby color with a small off-white head. Big nose of smoked meat, wood and caramelized fruit. Flavors are not as pronounced as the nose but good nonetheless. It was sweeter than I was expecting as the malt really makes its presence known. Slight hop bitterness. Medium-bodied. Another masterful beer from this brewery.
Brown color, little head. Nicely smoked, with some grilled meat aroma. Low carbonation. Medium body. Deep, sweet taste, slightly bitter finish.
Great smoked. Better than the original. A lot of malt character.Excellent appearance and aroma. First few sips are better than the following ones. Overall, excellent doppelbock.
Brown color. One-finger, off-white head. Aroma of bacon and malt . Sweet, malty taste with smoke and bread . Warming finish.
UPDATED: DEC 8, 2016 On tap @ Haket Pub. Amber with a small off white head. Smokey and malty tones. Malt, smoke, fruit and hops. Medium to full body with a nice malty / smokey finish.
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 Cerveza ahumada. Muy buena. Aunque tiene graduación no es fuerte. Medio cuerpo. Poco gas. Se bebe muy bien

Bright brown colored beer with a white head, low carbonation.
Tastes like smoke malt, fruity, oak, bacon, nuts and some bitter hops.
Nice smokey beer.

Clear amber color with airy white head. Aroma is smokey, tar, very nice aroma. Taste is quite sweet, smokey/tar flauvour, a bit sticky mouthfeel, also very nice. All in all very nice beer, well balanced and enjoyable.

Bottle courtesy of Bamsen. Clear dark amber, thick offwhite head. Smoky, slightly meaty aroma, wood and caramel. Meaty smoke flavour. Heavily malty and caramely with hoppy bitterness to balance. Good.

This beer. It smells like youre smoking bacon atop a clear mountain fresh with untouched snow. A clear mahogany base which foams heartily a thick tan head. Taste has the smooth bitter warmth of smoked meat and a long lasting finish. It is certainly less smoke in the mouth than the Marzen or Weizen, but this lightness  allows you to drink the 8% without blinking an eye. This beer is everything I want, and everything I need for any time of year.

Grande birra. Aroma di speck, leggerissimo burro, carne di maiale affumicato. Sembra di annusare un bel piatto di bacon e porchetta. Ambrato carico,presenta gli stessi sapori in bocca, amalgamati perfettamente, con una chiusura secca che continua a far emergere laffumicatura. Grandissima birra.

0,5l Flasche. Bier mit einer Farbe nach Mahagoni und einer kleinen Schaumkrone. Aroma nach Rauch und Holz. Schmeckt malzig, kräftig mit einer rauchigen Untermalung, Nuancen nach Holz, Rosinen und Caramel. Komplex und wahnsinnig gut!
Bottle. Medium redfish brown with tan head. Smells like smoked gouda and sunscreen (unscented). Tastes like smoked gouda.

O,5lt bottle @ Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos, Greece
Outstandind smoke beer. Really. If it was not a seaonal brew-only availble for December- I would drink that and nothing more all the year -when it needs a smoke beer, of course. And with a great dish.
Not as much smoky in the mouth as the classic Maerzen one but thats why it get better. More complexity and an oily mouthfeel with a lovely, very long-lasting aftertaste of smoky sweet malt and bit bitter. Nice carbonation, right as it needs. Superb!
On tällä panimolla kyllä savuoluisiin parhaat vinkit. Tämäkin on mainio. Ei paras, mutta hyvä.

Clear reddish/mahogany color with medium beige head. Oaky aroma, somy, with caramel, toffee, smoked meat and ashes. Taste follows the aroma, smoked meat, wood, campfire-like, sweet caramel, toffee notes as well. Less smoky than Urbock, but more balanced, with no alcohol precence.

Bottle from Alko. Copper color, white head. Bitter taste with smoke, malts, oak, a bit of hops, toast, earthy notes and a bit of nuts. Bitter finish with smoke, peat, malts, toast, nuts and a bit of hops. Exquisite smoked beer.
Copper caramel color with foam layer. Perfect oak smokey bacon nose. Creamy foamy feeling with a smokey bacon taste. Little bacon in the aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2017 Bottle, 0,5lt. Found at Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos. OMG - thats just the perfect smoked beer and WHY only available for 4 weeks in December?? It got a nice body, looks really rich and heavy. The aroma of course is smoky, but not as much as you thought for a doppelbock. Then, the taste: Thats 8% alcohol? Of course, the oak wood used gets deeper at all fases of sense-experience, but its not crushing the other tastes and aromas. A full body that lets you taste all the smoked malt and yet it is a beer there. Got 2 of it right away and it was delicious. The best balanced smoked beer without being a "drinkable bacon", in an amberlike color with not much carbonation (that pairs with the whole beer perfectly)
Clear brown color with small head. Intensive smoky aroma. Taste goes along with the aroma. Very good yet this is not as heavy as urbock. One of the best smoke beers

50 cl bottle from our lovely monopoly. Clear amber coloured with a small white head. Smoked aroma of burnt wood and sugar with notes of hops. Smoked flavour of burnt wood and hops. Smoked and hoppy finish. Tasty.
Rötlich braun im Glas, hellbrauner Schaum, rauchig in der Nase, schöner Körper, würzig, rauchig im Abgang. Nichts für mich
Bottle. Surprisingly light brown for Doppelbock. Smoky with a bit of bacon. Much more powerful mouth than nose, and very balanced, but not quite as heavy as the Rauchbier Urbock. I like it better.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2016 Brown-amber color with tan head. Aroma is a nice ham smoke, classic Schlenkerla. Taste is stingy, like medicine balls, dry bitter finish. Low and fine-bubbled carbonation. Nice, but not as stellar as the Urbock. 8-4-7-3-16
From the wood at Schlenkerla. As with all their gravity-poured beers, its got less carbonation and more balance. Still a bit medicinal, with a distinct Kräuterbonbon flavour, but its a beauty. Not much of the ridiculously drinkable, slight minerally saltiness of the Märzen left. A great winter sipper. Not as good as the Urbock, still, though. 8-4-8-4-17

This was poured into a mug.
The appearance was a hazy to semi-burnt dark amber to brown color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated at a nice pace.
The smell had some rich sweet smoked malts roaming over some light nutty character. Light caramel and toasty notes balance in nicely.
The taste was mainly sweet with the smoke coming in for the balance. Theres a slight smoky sweet aftertaste clinging on into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium in body with a nice sessionability about it. It gets creamy sweet yet shows a nice sticky clingy but not cloying feel on my tongue.
Overall, what a wonderful "smoked" beer close to a doppelbock. Id have again and wouldnt mind with its respected food.

Bière dexception,

Robe limpide, ambrée aux reflets bruns et rouges.Mousse fine et beige.
Arômes boisés, de fumée, de viande et de tourbe.
Corps et présence sublimes, profonds arômes fumés, de charcuterie et de bois fumés.
Excellent.

Yum, nice beer. Poured with a nice thick head and lots of lace. Aroma is mainly smoke with just a hint of malt. Flavors like nose, plus has some bitter/sweet/tang to balance the smoke and add interest. Good body. Fairly easy drinking for as full flavored as it is.

Average, fizzy, off white, mostly diminishing head, good lacing. Normal, medium amber body. Heavy malty aroma, with notes of hay, roasted and nutty. Light hoppy aroma, with notes of grass. Light yeasty aroma, with notes of dough and leather. Notes of smoke, tar, brown sugar and clove. Heavy sweet, light bitter and light acidic initial flavor. Average, moderate sweet, moderate bitter and moderate acidic finish. Medium to full body. Oily texture. Soft carbonation. Moderate alcoholic, light astringent finish.

Lukt: Røykt sild.
Utseende: Kastanje brun.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum.
Smak: Røykt sild.

Bottle at la cervesera artesana. Copper colour with whitehead. Smoked, bacon aroma. Smoked, sweet, malt taste, some caramel. Medium body.
(bottle) clear, bright amber colour with a medium tall beige head; aroma of smoke, smoked fruit, stewed fruit; tart, refreshing flavour with a long, light sour and bitter finish; excellent
Tons of campfire smoke on the nose. Sweet caramel malts are somewhat dominated by liquid smoke. Finishes astringently and lingers on an off dry note.

On draft at Klub Pivovarsky in Prague. It is only when you taste this beer out of context that you really get how good it is. Massive, magnificent and almost but not quite drowned in smoke that is absorbed into the body of a huge sweet lager. Just drink it - wherever you see it, drink it. You are not worthy but if it sits in your path take advantage.

Where: Old Line Fine Wine Spirits & Bistro. 
How: 500ml bottle.
Appearance: Amber and caramel colors. 
Aroma: Smoke, smoke, and bacon fat smoke. 
Taste: Flavors of rich malts, caramel, slight liquid smoke, maple bacon, caramelized sugar. 
Palate: Thin. 
Overall: This is a fantastic beer, amazing smoke. Drinkable and complex.
Bottle thanks to Kyotolefty. Pours out a amber topped with a small head. Nose is smoked meat malty note i cant get past the bacon. Taste is more of the smoked meat some toffee and pit fruit.

A beer of one of my favorite styles for German beer. In addition, it is smoked beer! Powerful and balanced, although with a somewhat high alcohol content that I already like. Only I, like most German beers, volume up too.

Aroma: smoked bakon, malts, barrel.
Taste: sweet.
Flavour: smoked bakon, smoked pork, oak barrel, tanins, toffee, spices.

Rich, flavorful, nourishing, very good.

Tap. Wood kissed by sunset color, of white fine head. Distinct campfire nose touch of malt underneath. Smoke in the mouth, but with a solid malty, dopplebock character underneath. Finishes with smoke. Better than the other smoke bets Ive had mostly because the smoke isnt overwhelming. Still, one is enough.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Clear dark amber with off-white head. Aromas of meaty smoked bacon, smoke, oak, hickory. Tastes of oak, smoke, light caramel, malt. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Really nice smoky aroma.

Clear brown with almost no head to speak of. The smoke is pretty different to their other offerings, mostly coming in the aftertaste. Chalky texture that suits the smoke well. Not their best (though it is the most subtle) but still solid.

Bottle. Pours a clear aber color with minimal white head. Heavily smoky aroma. Mostly sweet malt with a lot of smoky character. Medium bodied with a smooth, smoky finish. Fans of smoked beers must try this.
Strong rich oak smoked nose! Bock color. Malty but yet light start. Smokey throuout and lingers bitter with alcohol. Very unique but overpowering for my taste.

Doubling down on Aecht Schlenkerla this evening, as a doppelbock aficionado I enjoyed this smoked variation of the style. The aroma is not as overtly smoky as the marzen rauchbier rendition, more of a subtle burnt oaky aroma with the standard chocolate malt present. The appearance is unusually lighter and more transparent for the D-Bock style, and the white head receded more quickly, so it seemed. In addition to the forward smoky taste, there is a warm and delicious chocolate and rich caramel maltiness, definitely recognizable as a D-bock with an almost maple syrup-like taste. Interesting and enjoyable, and I do believe the smoke complements the chocolate well to create a s'mores-like taste, although I would prefer an unsmoked D-Bock to this. Also should be noted there was no booziness despite the 8% Abv.
Bottle at home. Tastes proper smoky. Rich bacon malt flavour. Sweetish. Very nice.

Bottled - Excellent smoked, rich malty aromas. Hazy brown colour with a nice tan head evaporating caramel, raisin and some woody scent. Sweet malty taste, bread, caramel, plums, raisins, smoked ham, low hop bitterness. Creamy, sticky texture, low carbonation, warm finish. A classic beer style with a massive, exciting smoky twist and a very complex malty taste. Very nice.

From a bottle into a Chouffe tulip glass. Pours amber orange with some particulates. Aroma of sweet malts, slight peat. Medium carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of rich malts, caramel, slight liquid smoke, maple bacon, caramelized sugar. Overall much less smoky than the other Schlenkerlas, and very drinkable, complex, unique and tasty.
smoke, smoke, smoke, smoke, smoke, smoke, smoke, smoke, light sweetness, medium bitterness, thin feel, medium body, lively,

-strong notes of smoked bacon (Serrano),camp fire and caramel
-syrup
-slightly spicy (Rosmaryn)
-slightly hoppy
-very sweet and slightly alcoholic finish

another great smoked one from schlenkerla
Lots of smoke and some caramel. Pours hazy brown with good head. Light sweet finish. Good for a smoked beer. Still retains a lot of that doppelbock feel. Bottle.

Bottle. Pours amber in colour, clear with slightly beige head. Aroma is oaky, woody with huge campfire, ham, bacon smokiness. In taste sweet, bread, caramel, smoky ham. Full to medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Alcohol well hidden. Nice, medium strength bitterness in the finish. Really great beer (also after more than one year cellaring). World class.
Bottle 50 cl. Reddish-bronze color with good foam. Aroma: heavy, smoked, burned wood, deep maltiness and wine. Taste: very smoked, porto, oak, malted, very warming. Great!
Tap at zly casy, prague. Dark copper color, white head. Aroma has smoke, some ham, rich malts. Rich sweet malty, smoke, balanced, some roasty notes.

Bottle, 500ml. Sparkling copper with a frothy to minimal tan head. Musky, earthy aromas of smoked wood, dried fruits, leather. Robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Rich, sweet and spicy, with a tremendous smoked malt character and a subtle but defining hoppy undertone. Exquisite fiery alcohol and smoked finish. An extraordinary beer.

Bottle, 500ml. A dark amber beer with a minimal white head. Intense smoked aroma of turkey bacon, spices and oak. Robust with some carbonation and astringency. Aftertaste is kind of salty and has a strong smoked character with a herbal hint at the end. Reminds me of charcuterie.

Amazing brew. Pours out a dark, almost black body with a thin tan head. Smoked malts and a rich toasted toffee and molasses malt. Sweet, chocolate, vanilla, molasses, caramel. Smoke is present but not overt. Nice heavy malt, alcohol is heavy but balances well. Good brew!

I have to admit that I found a bottle way past its sell by date in the back of the cupboard! No problem - as a lover of normal Schlenkerla this was mellow and still in perfect condition. Think Schlenkerla in a warm fur coat. Not as in your face smoky but still with the crispy bacon aroma that is the mark of Schlenkerla. An enjoyable drink.

Bottle drunk 7/9/15Well before even pouring this thing, the aroma seeping forth is a thoroughly enjoyable mix of blissful bacony-meaty goodness. Im guessing that this is ingrained in to this brewerys offerings at this point, as they claim in the commercial description that this is "smoother and more [subtle] than the more intensely aromatic beech smoke malt" which it certainly is not. This is the same great, malty, rich, meaty smokiness that we know and love. Its pretty preposterous to imagine that anyone but a seasoned woodsman or professional wood smoker could tell the difference in what wood was used. Even the temperature of the heat and seasoning of the wood would throw serious curveballs, not to mention adding it to a god damned beer! So, gimmicky? Undoubtedly. Wonderfully aromatic? Absolutely. The malt is certainly felt, richly sweet, with light melanoidins adding boisterous berries and though theres isnt a ton of dryness, the wood character itself mixes with some peppery phenols from the smoke to help lend some balance. No alcohol or flaws noted.Rich, chewy, heavily viscous maltiness is entwined with bacon-like smokiness up front, growing quite heavily sweet through the middle before a reprieve of vinous, melanoidin-rich acidity and dry wood char helps break it apart somewhat on the end. The sweetness creeps back in, especially with more warming, and the lower-than-usual carbonation for this brewery dosent help either. That being said, the smoked character is peerless, as always, and the acidic flavors almost save the day. As their biggest beer by a good margin, its a little more forgivable that this one be their most decadent and while its too sweet for me, ultimately, its easily taken as a dessert beer if youre in the mood/market for that.

Bottle from Blackrock cellar. Pours chestnut brown with little or no head. Smoked ham, oak, dark fruit, some light tobacco. Lots of caramel sweet below the smoky ham, oak. Gentle carbonation. Nice with cheese.

Hazy copper with a quickly dissipating head. Aroma rich and smoky with some sweet malt undertones. Taste smoky as well, but not overly intrusive, quite easy drinking for the ABV, with some sweet malty notes. Prefect accompaniment to some smoked meat and cheese :)
Miedziane, klarowne, piana drobna. Aromat do drewno i dużo dymu. Smak czysty, słodowy, nutu opiekane, skórka chleba. Goryczna na finisz zaznaczona (trawiasta i spalony sód ciasta). Nasycenie wysokie.

Bottle at home from Berlin, 3rd July 15. Pours clear and copper coloured. Aroma is meaty, smoke, malts and caramel. Taste is delicious, smoke, slight smoked meat, good sweetness, but not too much. Palate is rich, slightly oily. Lovely smoked affair
Magnificent smoke aroma and flavor, moderate bitterness. The only flaw I could find was a bit of astringency on the finish. Loved it.

Bottle shared during Pauls 30th - thanks to Daniel. Pours clear honey-gold with a foamy white head. Lovely nose with jars of smoked ham, some bread, faint caramel. Medium sweet flavorbwith slight cereal, some booze, toasted caramel, honey, smoked ham, slight leafy hops. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Lightly warming finish, a little oily, with more ham, moderate smoke, crunchy caramel, bread. Classic.

Bottle shared with dad at hos house. Pours a deep amber with a moderate white head that lasted about 60 seconds. Not overpowering smoke aroma with wet leaves, oak branches, caramel malts, and rawhide. The taste was mellow compared to the aroma with smoked wood, campfire, chewy caramel, brown sugar, and butter. The mouth was almost creamy and slick. Nice rauchbier without too much powerful smoke flavor.

Bottle, 0.50l. Clear amber brown color with large soapy off-white head and average sparkling appearance. Aroma of smoke, wood, roasted malt and leather. Taste starts with sweet caramel, follows by earthy, roasted and mild smokey, mouthfeel is warming and mild spicy, while finish is moderate bitter. Full body, syrupy texture and soft carbonation in palate. Sweet and strong caramel bomb, interesting that smoke is not much present in the taste...

Zapach z butelki drzewny, ogniskowy, do tego las, ściółka leśna  intensywny i przyjemny. Piana kremowa, wysoka ale opada dosyć szybko, koronkująca. W barwie piwo jasno-miedziane, klarowne. Aromat ze szkła oprócz silnego dymu i starego drewna to ciemne pieczywo, słód i nuty kojarzące się z wilgotną glebą. W smaku wyraźnie słodowe, karmelowe, chlebowe, drzewne, wędzone, ale w ogóle nie kojarzące się z szynką czy oscypkiem  jest wyraźnie inne. Lekko słodkie, nieco żywiczne. Goryczka jest miła, chmielowa, ziołowa, dopełniona lekkim przyjemnym alkoholem. Wysycenie dosyć wysokie. Piwo jak na ekstrakt zaskakująco pijalne i lekkie w odczuciu. Pełne, delikatnie alkoholowe.

Bottle. Poured copper color with a off-white head. The aroma is smoky wood and light caramel. The flavor is malty, caramel and burnt toast. Medium bodied with a lingering burnt woodiness. The smokiness dominates too much to drink more than one.
Wyraźny aromat wędzonki dymny i szynkowy, słodycz. W smaku podobnie, słodycz, wędzonka dymna i szynkowa, także trochę karmelu. Piwo pełne, gładkie. Goryczka średnia, w stronę niskiej.

In bottiglia da 50cl. Colore ramato, limpida, schiuma fine e poco persistente. Aroma affumicato, caramello, legno, frutta secca. Al palato corpo leggero e scorrevole nonostante la gradazione. Sentori ancora di legno e affumicato, fumo, caramello. Ottima birra e molto pericolosa per il rapporto bevibilità/gradazione
