Pour from 500 ml bottle, best before July 2015. clear, medium orange-amber with small head that quickly fades. lots of sediment. medium creamy body, average carbonation. smokey woody aroma, malty sweetness with light-medium bitterness and acrid smoke on the finish. Very nice winter sipper.

Coppery color with a white head with short to medium duration. Aroma has notes of smokiness, light caramel and wood. Flavor is slightly sweet, smoky, caramel, toasted malts with floral notes. Caramelish notes in the final with light smokiness. Very enjoyable.

Kolor bursztynowy, idealnie klarowne. Piana niezbyt obfita, szybko opada do cieniutkiej obraczki. W aromacie srednio intensywna wedzonka w wydaniu ogniskowym, troche karmelu, chleba, owocow, alkoholu i... ziemia, cale worki ziemi do kwiatow. W odczuciu pelne, oleiste, gladkie. W smaku wedzonki nie ma prawie wcale, jest za to sporo ziemi i calkiem sporo goryczki, ale generalnie niewiele sie dzieje.
Clear copper with white head. Smoke, ash, caramel and floral aroma. Smoke, sweet and floral finish. Overall: Nice and balanced. Excellent smoke.

500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy, reddish brown with a large, frothy, long lasting, off-white head that laces. Smoked malt aroma with wood and caramel. Sweet flavour of caramel with smoked malt and wood, leading to a dry, bitter finish. Medium body with a smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Nicely done and well balanced.

Smoke is the main player here, like with pretty much all of Aecht Schlenkerla beers. Good mix of sweet malts to compliment the smoke. This was another treat from this brewer. Not getting much of the hops. Good beer and somewhat original.
Røget blød øl. Den minder om en wiskey, men er ikke med skarp eftersmag. Ikke for alle, da den er røget.

Aroma: smoke, caramel, 
Appearance: amber, clear, white head
Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, smoke
Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 

Excellent

Bottle from McHughs in Dublin. As soon as you open the bottle the smokiness hits you but its not unpleasant. Theres a real oaky smokiness with this and cured bacon but also fairly sweet with dark malt and dark fruit but with a smoothish mouthfeel. For me the "smoky bacon" is just a little too much but nice all the same.

Aroma: ham, smoke, caramel, bread
Taste: light bitter, heavy sweet, ham, smoke, bread, caramel

500 ml bottle from Bier-Deluxe.de
Copper, clear body, with a medium, creamy, off-white head.
Aroma of bacon, lots of sweet, dark malts, slight ash.
Taste follows this, with some more sweet fruits and subtle hops.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes smokey, bitter.sweet, a bit wooden.

Very good. Typical bacon notes, paired with a big, smooth malt body. Alcohol is pretty well hidden. Didnt enjoy this as much as the Urbock though.

bottle kindly shared by Saeglopur, many thanks Thomas :) smells smoked, strong smell of bacon, creamy, quite nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel, rather sweet, taste of bacon, citric, light wooden note in the background. finishes rather bitter / sweet. smells nice, taste is a bit weird bitter / sweet, expected a bit more.

Piwo o pięknej miedzianej barwie, idealnie klarowne. Piana drobna, utrzymuje się. Aromat - POTĘŻNA WĘDZONKA, szynkowa, z nutą "ogniskową". Smak - wędzonka porządna ale nie tak silna jak w aromacie. Piwo nieco szczypie w język, czuć te 8%. Wędzoność nie zdominowała całkowicie smaku, czuć że to dopplebock - karmelowa pełnia, solidne ciało, nuty suszonych owoców. Średnio wysycone. Zacne.
Old rating. Love these smoked Beers. Dark brown pour. Bacon, ham, campfire, wood dominate. No apologizes. Medium bodied. Drinkable as rauchs go. Yum.

Smoked ham in aroma, caramel, some booze. Copper colour, white head, unfortunately not very stable. In the taste smokeness is very nice, but there is not too much more, alcohol is not hidden very well and starts to disturb in the middle of the bottle. The beer lacks of body and complexity. Overall solid but not my favor one from Bamberg.
Bottle->lager. Mirky lite brown with moderate offwhite head. A: smoke, bacon, malt. T: same, but more malt with smoke subdued. Really nice.
500ml bottle from apivo.ru. Pours amber with a small head. Aroma is burnt wood and smoky bacon. Sweet smoky taste. Smooth and very drinkable.
50cl bottle purchased at Havnelageret pub, Norway. Pours a nice, slight brown colour. Aroma reminds a little of bacon. The taste is sweet despite the smell of bacon. Would definitely try again.

ASPETTO: ambrato un po chiaro, limpidissimo, con schiuma bianca, abbastanza abbondante, che diminuisce velocemente, ma che ne rimane sempre un millimetro sulla superficie. AROMA: soprattutto un ottimo affumicato, legno di montagna, unito a del caramello. GUSTO: soprattutto maltato, affumicato e anche caramello. Luppolo quasi assente. Corpo e carbonizzazione medi. CONCLUSIONE: birra molto gradevole e beverina (nonostante i suoi 8 gradi). Batte sempre sullaffumicato e maltato, e questo fa si che alla lunga rilasci un retrogusto un po stucchevole. Ma ciò non toglie che stiamo davanti ad una grande birra.

0,5 l bottle from Bierzwerg, best before 31/5/2015. Slightly hazy, luscious, orangeish amber with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, tan to white head. Lovely aroma of raisins, molasses and cane sugar, covered by a heavy, smoky layer of coal and burnt wood. Superb sweetish taste of raisins, molasses and cane sugar, accompanied with a lovely, not overshadowing, smoky flavour of coal and burnt wood. Relatively short, slightly bitter finish with a lasting smokiness. Medium to full body, smooth and oily mouthfeel, soft to average carbonation. Again a wonderful Schlenkerla brew, so well balanced and intense. Absolutely no recognition of the 8% abv, just damn quaffable.
Bottle. Pours a transparent amber with almost no head at all. Aroma is heavy on the bacon and smokiness. Taste is more subtle of the aroma with a smoked meat flavor that lingers.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Pours deep clear brown colour with a small and quickly fading head.Moderately strong aroma of smoke, some caramel and dried plum. Some alcohol note is present too. The taste is much better with a very distinct bonfire smoke note, a hint of caramel and dried fruits and a pleasant slighty bitter finish. I found it unexpectedly dry, lacking the body that doppelbocks are famous for but enjoyed it enough to be satisfied.

Kolor: bursztynowy, klarowny. 
Piana: dość obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, zwarta i trwała, zostawia ślady na szkle. 
Zapach: wędzone śliwki, lekkie melanoidyny, aromaty opiekane, karmel. 
Smak: solidna baza słodowa, duża pełnia, wyraźna słodycz, wędzonka również konkretna jak w aromacie, wyczuwalne również nuty opiekane, goryczka, niska może w kierunku średniej o lekko przypieczonym charakterze. 
Wysycenie: średnie, bardzo dobre.
UPDATED: DEC 14, 2015 Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours dark orange. Nose is smoke, smoked ham, sweet malts. Taste is sweet malty with smoky notes, caramel, tar.
Braun, rötlich. In der Nase herzhafter Schinken, Rauch, Eichenoten. Am Gaumen schöne Süße, Eiche, Schinken, leicht herb, Malz. Süffig. SEhr gutes Rauchbier.

WYGLĄD: Barwa miedziana, klarowne. Piana niska, drobna.
AROMAT: Wyraźnie beczkowy aromat, intensywna dębowa dymioność. Oczywiście są wyczuwalne, ziołowość, korzenność słody i karmel.
SMAK: Dobre proporcje wędzoności, goryczki oraz słodowości. Lekki karmel, alkohol jest i rozgrzewa przełyk.
OGÓLNIE: Kolejne bardzo udane piwo "klasyk" z tego browaru.

great, intense smoky aroma, malty, caramel, very distant hoppy notes; amber, light brown, clear, minimal off-white foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, umami?, medium+ body, oily, thick feel, very soft carbonation, long bittersweet finish;
Overall: very, very smoky, like liquid sausage :), great aroma, fine palete and taste, very well-made but too sweet for me

Podane/Served: 2015.03.16, Lager glass, 9°C
 Partia/Batch: 07 2015, 0,5l Bottle
Aromat/Aroma: 
Wędzony boczek, słodowe, ziołowe. Skromny charakter koźlaka.
 / Smoked bacon, malt, herbs. Modest bock character.
Wygląd/Appearance: 
Klarowna miedziana. Piana solidna, długa, do końca.
 / Clear copper. Solid head, lasting till the end.
Smak/Taste: 
Drewniany, wędzony boczek, dym liściastego drzewa, świeży chlebowy.
 / Woody, smoked bacon, smoke of leaf tree, fresh bread.
Odczucie/Palate: 
Gęste, pełne, gładkie, wysokie wysycenie. Alkohol ukryty.
 / Dense, full, smooth, high carbonation. Alcohol is hidden.
Ogólnie/Overall: 
Pyszny.
 / Delicious.
Amber color, small foam. Light smoke aroma, and light sweet taste. It feels plain and like it miss some more stronger aroma.
0.5l bottle. Cloudy copper color with small browny head. Aroma of smoke, caramel and sugar. Taste is sweet with some alcohol present.

Bottle- amber with a small fizzy light brown head. aroma of firewood, smoke and peat. Taste of peat, firewood, light smoke, caramel and toffee with a little smoked bacon. Heavy body, high carbonation.

[Tap] Deep amber in color with a large and lasting off-white head. Aromas of meaty smoke, oak, peat and sweet toffee. Flavors are more sweet than smokey. Toffee, earthy malts, vanilla and milder wood smoke. Lively carbonation. Lingering toffee and brown sugar. Tasting notes from 8/2014.

500ml bottle, amber-copper color, with a small bubbly beige head, with a nice smoked, toasted,biscuity, caramelized, bread malty nose, with some smokey ham, meaty, smoked mussel, toffee, brown sugar, sugar pie accents, and a Grahams cracker, sponge toffee, caramel chip cookie dough, subtle fruity yeast, earthy smoked peat moss note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate, with a warmth sweet toasted, biscuity, caramelized, bread, smoked malty, toffee, fruity yeast, dark dried fruit character, with some smoked ham, smoked mussel, sugar pie, caramelized breadcrumb, fruitcake, sponge toffee, faint Grahams cracker, brown sugar flavours, leading towards a warming toffee, caramel brown sugar, biscuity, caramelized, toasted, bread, smoked maltiness finish.

Bottle from the National Winter Ales Festival. Pours amber with a thin cream head. Light smokey aroma. The flavour starts sweet with caramel notes and a big lingering smokey bacon finish. Very smooth feel. Lovely.

Pours a clear dark amber/coppery color, topped with a fairly small white head. Smokey aroma is not too strong, but still very easy to pick up. The taste is slightly sweet and very smokey (bacon quality), a bit too strong on the smoke-side for me, but still easily drinkable.

Wasnt sure where this would pitch between a dopplebock and a smoked beer. Unsurprisingly given the maker it leans more towards the latter but this is far from a one dimensional beer. Its dark amber, verging on brown, with the slightest of white heads. Thick and creamy texture. Nose is very smoky and meaty; taste is more of a blend of smoky wood and sweet malt. The alcohol comes in part way through but not in an overpowering way, and there is a really pleasant dryness to the finish. Great.
Pours clear amber, minimal head. Smells like oak smoke, ham, charcoal grill. Taste matches, quite smoky, smoked meats, finishes a bit bitter. Good, not as good as marzen.
Bottle. Clear brown color, medium fast diminishing head. Full bacon, smoked ham aroma, deep and rich, 3rd best rauchbier ever:-)

Pufff una buena doppelbock pero con la q para mi gusto se han pasado con el humo...huele casi solo a humo y sabe a humo con algo de dulce de la DB...no me ha molado nada. No me he podido terminar ni la mitad...no es para mi

Sample at the Paas monthly tasting.
Smokey aroma. No head. Clear amber pour. Lots of bacon/smoke in the aftertaste.

Aroma of caramel malt, honey, and smoke. Dark amber pour with a small white head that leaves lacing. Rich, sweet flavor with a creamy mouthfeel and the right amount of smoke. Has a meaty taste, like smoked salmon. Has a smooth, sweet, refreshing palate, with a slight amount of tartness. This would pair well with many kinds of food, an excellent rauchbier.

Appearance: Dark transparent bronze and brown colored body with a fluffy off-white eggshell colored head that stands up pretty good.

Aroma: Smells like smoked sausages, a bit of rosemary, and a spicy clove scent. I feel it is important to note that the label does state "Schlenkerla Oak Smoke" and the back explains that the malt is kilned with oak wood, which would explain the smoked sausage aroma...so its not a bad thing. It reminds me of summer campfires and cookouts. Its hard to explain why the aroma is so unique and pleasant...it just is.

Taste: Wow there is this caramel sweetness mixed with a hint of smokey flavor. Its not as rich as I would expect from a Doppelbock...a bit thin, but still tasty. Most of the flavor comes from the smokey presence.

Mouthfeel: Despite the smokiness it is not bitter or acrid which is a plus. It does feel rather thin for a Doppelbock, but it is smooth.

Overall: Its a very nice and unique beer especially if you consider the smoke flavor and aroma. For this reason alone I would say give it a shot. Its not the malty sweet caramel Doppelbock you are probably used to, but it is its own beast. The spicy quality of the beer wins a merit on their own. This is a great beer to pair with food. Have fun with it.

Pours a somewhat cloudy amber with a subtle garnet hue. Normal head volume and retention, outstanding lacing.

Rich nose of bacon cooking over an oak campfire. Underneath is a subtle caramel sweetness. The aroma is less intense than the Marzen and Urbock variants.

Almost full bodied with a rich texture that is oily and creamy. Below normal carbonation level with almost no effervescence in the finish.

The flavor profile is near World Class. It is reasonably intense, a bit complex and exceptionally well balanced. It begins with a burst of oak smokiness that lacks the meaty aspects of the nose, that slowly blends, rather than fades, with a rich underlying sweetness. Both caramel and biscuit notes are present. Here is where the rich malts of a doppelbock kick in. In the middle, a balancing mild bitterness emerges over a vanilla note. The finish is a slow fade of oak smoke and sweetness with a slight note of alcohol.

Geruch sehr angenehm nach Rauch, Schinken und Holz. Geschmack geht dann etwas nach Kohle, aber hauptsächlich nach Bacon, Rauch und etwas nach Rosmarin. Sehr lecker, aber nur in kleinen Dosen zu genießen.
Vorsichtiger Rauchgeruch. Im Geschmack dann vollmundig und leicht rauchig. Nicht so schlimm wie die Anderen. Vollmundig, aber nicht süß. top

Bottle. Clear brown color, medium fast diminishing head. Full bacon, smoked ham aroma, deep and rich, but not deterring. Full-bodied taste, light sweet, medium balanced bitter. Goes down the throat like oil, low carbonated, could be a bit fresher, medium nearly thick mouthfeel. Leaves a nice, but not annoying smokiness on your tongue, just great. 

Great smokebeer, even better than the also great Märzen.

1 pint .9 oz bottle, poured into a mug at approximately 40 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a clear golden red, almost orange-tinted, and forms quite a thick pale beige head that leaves crazy amounts of lacing as it slowly recedes. Bubbles line the bottom of the glass, and rocket upwards sporadically rather than in columns.

Smell: Dark, dank smoke swirls out of the glass, redolent with scents that remind me of a pork shoulder going in my smoker on a spring afternoon. Theres a sweetness underlying the smoke, like caramel. The smoke scent itself, while allegedly oak, reminds me more of burning a mix of peat and hickory.

Taste: Oh my, that is a smooth-drinking beverage. The taste opens with a sweet caramel malt that seems to have been aged in oak barrels, which is suddenly overtaken in the middle by the taste of fire-blackened pork still dripping with fat. As it progresses, the meaty essence gives way first to charred and ashy wood, and by the finish, to a peaty soot. While there are allegedly Hallertau hops present, I can find no hop character to this beer (which is a plus for me), beyond the slight earthy-peaty tone to some of the smoke. There is no indication at all that this contains alcohol, just sweetness and smoke.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied and quite drinkable, this feels like silk along the palate.

Overall: My first encounter with a Schlenkerla, and assuredly not my last. While the label says "doppelbock", Id call this more of a rauchbier, as the primary characteristic is the smoke - theres nowhere near the level of bready, toffee, caramel, nutty, or dark fruit flavors I would associate with a doppelbock, nor the sticky mouthfeel. That being said, its quite good for a smoked bier!
Le goût fumé prend beaucoup de place. Malheureusement, le côté sucré de la bière est plutôt caché par ces effluves fumées.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2016 Aroma of sweet malts, smoked bacon, charred wood, smoked ham. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet with a light bitter finish. This is like drinking smoked pork straight from the barbecue.

Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl
@ Cerveceria Seny.
A: Brown / Marron.
T/S: Smoked bacon, malt, sweet / Bacon ahumado, malta, dulce.

Aroma: bacon, smoked sausage, salty. Appearance: clear amber, small, white, creamy head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: sweets intensify, malty, grain, bread, caramel, savoury flavours coming up, bacon and sausages again, medium carbonation, medium body. Overall: fantastic Smoked, big fan of this Dobbelbock variation. Pint at CASK Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico.

Aroma of sweet cereal malts with a gentle but rich smoky background, some prune, and a very mild citrus-oregano hop character. Appears clear copper. Tastes of sweet cereal and caramel with a hint of bacon. Overall, very nice!

Rating #1109 - May 29, 2014 - Bottle from CBI. Pours an amber brown in colour with a minimal tan head that fades quickly. Distinct smoky, vanilla/toffee aroma oozes out. Very unique body, medium alcohol warmth, predominant smokiness on the palate tempered with the dry, bitter roast malt character of the stout. Medium alcohol character, especially for 8% - finishes much smoother, rounded flavours compared to other Schenkerla I have sampled. Really good smoked brew.

Beautiful rich amber colour, slight head. Aroma is charred wood, over-ripe fruit, banana, charcoal. Great smokey, fruity flavours, like a burnt "dubbel". Palate is rich and smooth. I really wasnt expecting this to be so sweet and greedy. Much, much less in your face than other smoked beers Ive tried. This will become a regular in the "cellar".

Color caoba limpio con espuma marfil compacta y duradera. Aromas ahumados muy intensos, con toques especiados más sutiles y un fondo de caramelo. Cuerpo denso, con inicio de dulzor moderado que recuerda al azúcar moreno, al que sigue intenso sabor ahumado y especiado y un final seco sutil.

the aroma is caramel and smokey with some hints of candy... the taste contains, except traditional smoked malt, the notes of oak barrel and some fruity sweetness... smoked sweet and bitter aftertaste...

Bottle, 500mL. @Strasbourg, bar "Aux 12 Apôtres". With GG&Jeff&children. A clear dark brown mahogany beer with a good off-white creamy head ; good retention. Smoky roasty aroma, caramel, spices, coffee. Medium sweet and bitter, light salty : nice balance. Medium body and oily texture, good carbonation, sweet finish herbal & salty. Overall, WOW, my first beer in this style : utterly delicious, what the hell is this smoked salmon aroma ?! Glad to discover a new area in the taste spectrum.

500ml bottle: poured an intense ruby colored body, not so tall beige head that disappears completely after a few minutes. Smells strongly of smoke and has some malts notes. Tastes like smoked meat, roasted malts, wood and a bit bittery. I think its the best smoked beer Ive had so far!

Pours a coffee colored robe with a medium carbonation and topped with an average persistent head of a beige aspect. It hits the nose with a powerful hickory scent. The taste is smooth, smoky and slghlty meatty. My first experience with a smoked beer and it was pleasant. Also this is the 100th brand I tried in my life! Cheers!

Pours a clear copper with a thin film for a head that leaves pretty good lacing considering how small it is. Aroma is smoke and some malty syrup. Taste is sweet and lightly fruity, offers more smoke and is almost cloying. Smoke level is dialed in just right though, it is just too sweet for my taste. Body is medium-full, carbonation critically low and mouthfeel syrupy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours clear red amber with low head. Aroma is smoked bacon and ham. Full bodied. Taste is smoky malts, ham and wood.

Overtly smokey, bacon and brown sugar. Nose stronger in smokiness than palate. Was really looking forward to the bottle but really did not enjoy it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille de 500ml. Liquide cuivrée avec de légères particules. Une mousse beige épaisse, Une bouche dont tout se joue avec cette texture crémeuse, huileuse et compacte. Les saveurs comme les flaveurs sont légèrement fumées. Facile à boire. Savoureuse.

Spina @ fob.
Ambrata con schiuma fine e persistente.
Attacca con una affumicatura molto importante, poi esce fuori del malto dolce e finale amarognolo 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

500ml bottle. Dark amber colour with average, thick, frothy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, sulphureous head. Intense, "fleshy" smoky aroma, bacon, ham etc., oak ashes. Taste is smoky in the same direction, underlying malt sweetness, counterbalancing hop bitterness. Sounds simple but is oh soooo good, so well balanced, intense, but not overdone, pushing the boundary right to the edge. One of the highest peaks in Beer Himalayas.

On tap at the Birre Sotto l'Albero festival in Rome-ITALY (Macche and Bir&Fud). Pours copper, bronze filtered colour with a tick off white head. Nose: balanced smoked cheese notes, malts. Mouth: bread malts, light bitterness and medium high carbonation. Very interesting beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I adore the original marzen schlenkerla, which is smoked as hell. 
This one however turned out to be stronger but less smoker, so the whole idea didnt really go well

Bottle from hop hideout, sheffield. bronze coloured ale with wispy off white head. Aroma is all smoke, reminds me most of smoked sausage, hard to pick out anything else! Taste is quite sweet, which masks the alcohol a bit, the smoke brings a little bitterness. Thick body, plenty of oil, tingly carbonation, beautifully balanced palate. I liked it the more I drank, but the aroma took me by surprise a bit!
Bottle at home. Pours deep amber, nose is oaky, smoked sausage, taste is sweet, malty toffee, dry, peaty smoke.

500 ml bottle. Pours an orange mahogany with moderate head that settles quickly. Aromas of wood smoke, oranges and light toffee. Flavors of smoke, sweet toasted malts, marmalade, and light caramel. Definitely smoother than a normal smoked beer. I that is due to the oak wood its definitely a good thing.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2015 Initial Rating Date: 12/7/2014 2:14:49 PM:
From brewers droop, Bristol BBE:07/2015
Blood alc: 0mg/100ml

Sweet honey like soft smoked aroma with a light booziness. Really nice. The beer is deep red orange with a head just off white. Wow. Flavour is beautiful smoke with bright fruits, raisins and a lingering bitterness with a sweet malty backbone. Full bodied, perfectly suited to the flavours.
=92%


Deciding to re-rate as it smells amazing. Beautiful deep ruby orange colour with brilliant clarity. The head is a little orange and lasts and lasts. Amazing smoked ham aroma with a tiny hint of tobacco. On tasting, the texture is silky smooth with fine carbonation and a high quality smoked ham flavour. On the end there is a substantial but not imbalancing bitterness - a synergy I expect between both hops and smoke. The alcohol is masked very well but is detectable in the finish. Same score. Still brilliant.

Aroma is slightly smoky, the taste resembles the Märzen without the very overwhelming sensation of bonfire smokiness, but with a much more detailed multi variate smokiness where you fully get to appreciate the different layers of smoke. It is slightly bitter with subtle tones of liquorice, but as it warms it slightly sweetens. The appearance is a bark amber colour with some carbonation. Overall, I cannot recommend this beer! Knowing how few ever get made, if you are not brave enough to seek this out on your own, you should never be given the opportunity to taste this, for it is a very particular niche we are dealing with here, not for everyone. Most people would not like this beer.

Draught at GBBF 2012. Poured a hazy, but bright orange, with a dense white head. Aroma of smoked malt and bacon, but slightly toned down from some of their other offerings, with juicy fruits and some spice. Earthy malt in the flavour, with some spruce and smokiness coming through. Finish was peat, chewy grain and grass.

500mL bottle, pours a hazy dark golden orange with a medium white head. Aroma brings out a lovely smoky ash pit - typical for Aecht Schlenkerla smoke beers. Flavour isnt as smoky as expected, with loads of caramel malt upfront, followed by ashy smoke, and smoked meat. Full-bodied, chewy and meaty, with moderate sweetness. Classic smoked doppelbock - doesnt get much better than this.

Bottle. Murky brown pour with light white head. Aroma, wow, bacon, smoke, ash, smells like smokey beef jerky. Taste is light malty sweetness, followed by smoke, ash, finishes with more smoke, mouthfeel and carbonation are medium. This is great, really smokey aroma and the flavour combination of a smoked beer combined with the malty sweetness that you would expect from a bock works really together.

Tap. Sheffield Tap. Copper colour. Bit of haze. Thin, off white, sticky head. Savoury smokiness, like Kempke bacon, or smoked sausage. Some woodiness in there. Some ripe orange fruitiness, too. Taste is fairly sweet. Savoury dry. Hint of bitterness at the end levels things up. Smooth palate, but prickly carbonation helps in this not being too chewy. Finishes smoky sweet, with a dry, gentle bitter close. Super drinkable. Feels nothing like 8%. Lovely.

Bottle poured a hazy orange-brown hue w/ a one finger fizzy beige head fully diminishing. Moderate sweet smokey aroma. Initial flavor is bold sweet w/ a mild bitter finish. Tastes are brown sugar, smoke, and light toast. Full bodied and balanced mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from bottle into a tulip: Pours light muddy brown with a thin off white head. Aroma of smoke and sweet malts. Taste is smoke, nuts, sweet fruits. Medium body, sticky mouthfeel. Nice beer.

500ml bottle - 

I enjoyed this one from the "rauchbier" perspective and not the "dopplebock" because there were little to no dopplebock characteristics that I could detect under the onslaught of wonderful smoke. Liquid smoke/campfire aroma, thin scant white head on the pour with a dominant smokey flavor of smoked meat with an odd green peppery hint. Finish has a medium-sweetness to it which helps. Not nearly has flavorful as the Urbock. Still, quite good.
Vörösesbarna szín. Illata: Mint a kamra, amiben füstölt árukat tartanak disznóvágás után. Habja egyáltalán nincs. Izében is jelen van a füstösség a maláta édessége mellett.
Deep amber pour. Aromas of maple smoked bacon, light roast. Flavour is nicely smokey with toffee and caramel malts. Really nice.

Robe orangée, limpide, carbo moyenne, petit collet.
Aromes fumé, bois, caramel.
Saveurs douce, le fumé est relativement discret bien contrebalancé par le sucre caramel.

Aroma is deep smoke, highly roasted malts, caramel and brown sugar. Taste is rich sweet malts with a oak sweetness and light well balanced hoppiness that finishes pretty smoothly. Appearance is a clear gold /amber with a pearl white head that retains fairly poorly.
Bottle. Amber, cloudy, rocky head, tan foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & bitter finish.

Dark pumpkin orange, with hints of brown at the thick parts. Not much head, but a lovely foamy film that sits on top of the beer. The body doesnt look amazing, but the color is great. 

The aroma is an amazing -- AMAZING -- peat smoke. Brings me flashbacks to childhood campfires. Smoked bacon and grilled meats. If you didnt know this was a beer, you might think your nose was over a grill. I cant say enough about the aroma: it taps directly into a sense of childhood simplicity, like a carnival or a backyard picnic.

The flavor, again, is smoked meat: bacon and smoky, blackened brisket. Not like a barbecue, but like meat slowly smoked over coals and blackened wood. Its not a spiciness, a la a chipotle ale, but rather like a dry, smoky Rauchbier or a Russian peat-smoked tea.

The feel of the beer is slick and oily. It has a thickness on the back end. I do have to say that this is best consumed in small doses. And while it might pair well with a smoked BBQ, it might also be overkill. It might pair even better with a sweeter sauce.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2014 1 pint bottle served in shaker- poured a transparent lightened amber with a tint of orange when held to a light source, no head but some frog eyes upon the surface. Near to zero carbonation, aroma of SMOKE (pure smoke, with fish and bacon), leather, and sex- OH YEAH! Hits the mouth with an extremely wide body, malt was smoked with German perfection, middle has an almost Arctic Char (fish) quality to the taste, finish is delightful with heavy strides of smoke and notes of sweetness. That was NICE.

A while since I drank this, but I remember a) the slightly fishy smoked aroma, b) finding it very drinkable, and c) the distinct and unique aftertaste of sweet chestnuts. Liked this stand-out beer an awful lot.

Bottle from Yankee in Sturbridge. Poured into a tall lager glass. Light amber color. Thin off-white head. Excellent smoky aromas with light oak. Flavor is complex. Light sweetness. Good bitterness. Smoke and vanilla notes. Plenty satisfying. I really like this one!

Pours a nice iced tea colour with a very light brown head. At certain angles the copper colour really shines through and theres a great visible carbonation. Aroma of smoked meats and leather. Great smokey flavour - bacon, leather, charcoal and a very slight licorice.tjis would go excellently with smoked cheese on a cold day. Holy horn . Where do they hide the 8%? Beer is nice and dense with a light carbonation that doesnt over power. Coats the mouth well and keeps me coming back.
Light appearance. Aroma is pleasant malty sweetness. Taste is overwhelming sweetness. Good, not great.

Intense feu de malt qui laisse respirer un cortex sucré imposant et complexe. La texture est suave et presque vicieuse avec les malts fûmés qui grattent le palais avant dêtre nettoyés par un cortège de caramel chaud. Brillant.

"looks pretty light for a doppel, significantly lighter than the urbock. different wood made a siginificant difference in the aroma and flavor. full bodied, full of oak and slightly less smokey than the rauch beirs. the smoke and sweet malt compliment eachother to make a nice and tasty, aromatic brew."

Amber pour with light white head and lace. Aroma is medium smoke, light brown sugar, oak, and raisins. Flavor is large sweet malt, smoke, pepper, fruitiness and a touch of earthy bitters. Medium bodied with good carbonation. A well hidden 8% abv. a really surprising beer for me

Purchased at Liquor Shed.

A clear copper pour, small head of foam, not much lacing.

The smoke sure does dominate the nose. I get a hint of malty sweet notes from the DB base beer but not much.

More of the DB style shines through in the taste. Bready, sweet, and of course, the smoke.

Medium body, light to medium co2.

A brewery famous for their rauchbiers, this did not disappoint.

Na podstawie dwóch butelek. Pierwsza była idealna mnóstwo przytłaczającego dymu wędzarniczego, szlachetnego przypominającego naprawdę dobre wędzone wędliny, a nie zwykłą kiełbasę :) ciężkie piwo. Druga przedstawiła już niestety nieco utlenienia w postaci mokrego kartonu.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark amber with small spongy off-white head, smoky aroma, smoky caramel like taste,thin body, low carbonation, very smooth long finish with smoky aftertaste. Smoke is all about this beer in fact, but I like it.

Aroma:smoked ham,light caramel...
Appearance:DArk hazy cooper,light head..
Flavor:smoked,light honey..

Bottle - 500ml. Beautiful cloudy chestnut budy with an average off-white frothy head. Lovely malty/hoppy aroma with smokey, oaky, and some spicy hints. Alcohol is well hidden. Its robust taste carries strong oaky notes. Herbs and brown sugar are also noticeable. Ends with a long bitter/smokey finish. Solid!

Gets a ten for the wonderful aroma of German spiced smoked bacon. Buttery, I could expect to be drinking Gruen Speck in a glass. Coppered colour, with a yeasty type of haze in suspension, the flavour is less smoky or swinish. More like a benevolent bock, sweet, with hardly any bitterness, and some cranberry tartness. Brief finish. It is still a worthy relative of those lovely Bamberg smoked beers.

Bottle thnx to sam . 
Pours clear , dark amber . 
No real head . Smell is smoked . 
Good carbo . 
Taste is smoked in a subtle yet clear way . Pure smokyness , but elegant . I can not enjoy this , but this is one of the first smokeds i can drink ( a bit ) . Some connection is made with smoked cheese i had a couple of weeks ago ..
It tastes like a smoky doppelbock. The smoke is not overwhelming, but it is strong. I enjoy the mix of flavors. Very bitter finish--I think its from the hops, not the smoked malt.

The aroma of smoke (bacon) drifts up a medium amber pour wih with ivory head and no lacing. The taste is smoky with flora hints and toasted malts. Medium-full body and moderate carbonation. Overall, this is very tasty and not as smoky as some other Aecht brews. It is my favorite so far.
Bottle. Pours clear dark amber. Smells and tastes like old bacon. Not a fan.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Copper coloured with sweet red fruit and currant flavours, strong smoked beechwood notes and a roasted finish.
Bottle. Medium amberish copper color with a small head. Really nice smoked flavor better than most smoked beers. Taste is wonderfully smooth and mild but still great smoked flavor

Appearance: Clear deep nutty color with an off white head. Ok lacing.Aroma: Bacon, oak and smoked aroma.Palate: Medium + body. Tad sweet and a moderat bitterness. Soft to average carbonation.Taste: Mild smoked and some ham, bacon, oak and a fine malty background.Overall impression: Decent smoked beer.Personal stats: Bottle at Havnelagert in Fredrikstad, Norway. Shared by kaaz

Deep gold pour with very little head, light carbonation. Aroma - smoke, more smoke, more wood fire than meaty. Taste - slightly sweet, toffee, smoky - this is more a bacony smoke than in the aroma. Nice, very different, quite enjoying it on a winter night

Belle bière cuivrée, coiffée dune mousse timide qui se résorbe rapidement en un mince voile qui reste en place. Une dentelle est observée. Ça sent le hareng fumé, le bois et des fruits quelconques. Un goût plutôt doux en bouche. Certes cest fumé, mais pas trop. C,est aussi caramélisé, ou peut-être est-ce du miel boisé et légèrement amer. Ça goûte par moment le raisin sec. M.A. 06-2014 (1137-040714)
A nice smoked beer, not as intense as other beers. Pours a very nice deep orange, with very little head. Smells and tastes of oak and BBQ. Had on tap at The Ginger Man in NYC.

Pours a quick dissipating head atop a clouded, sediment-filled brown orange body. Nose of pre-cooked biscuit dough. Minor taste of smoke and very breaded malt through the body, some hidden pears and honey. The flavour hides the 8%ABV very very well. So smooth and not as "smoked jerky" as the Marzen. Very nice, calm and sip-able. Bottled April 2011, sampled in a tulip glass. Thanks Alessandro!

500 ml bottle. Clear, dark amber color, short-life medium size yellowish beige head, slight smoked ham aroma, medium body, decent carbonation, sweet malty and toffee taste, smokey palate without hoppy notes. Nice one but too sweet for me.
Clear copper with a thin film of head. Aroma more of oak than smoke and some syrup. Taste is sweet over bitter. Body is medium, carbonation low. Heady stuff.
500ml bottle from Archive Beer Boutique 040514. Lots of campfire smoke in the aroma and a good dose of smokiness in the flavour.

Pours a clear copper with a thin film for a head that leaves pretty good lacing considering how small it is. Nose is of smoke (duh) and some malty syrup. Taste is sweet and lightly fruity, offers more smoke and is almost cloying. Smoke level is dialed in just right though, it is just too sweet for my taste. Body is medium-full, carbonation critically low and mouthfeel syrupy. Nice smoked beer but I feel like it would be more enjoyable if it was just a tad lighter.

Bottle (500 ml). Almost clear copper with a medium diminishing off-white head and little lacing. Aroma is gently smoked with wooden notes, caramel, nice fruitiness, breadied malt and noble hops. Taste is moderately smokey with a lot of oak, breadied malt, caramel and light fruitiness. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Smooth but long lasting smokey finish. Light alcohol warming. The smoke is present like in every beer from Schlenkerla, but it fits surprinsingly well with the Dopplebock style. Complex. Really good balance. Well executed.

Draft. Clear amber with a thin white head. Aroma is bacon, smoke and light oak. Taste follows pretty closely and has plenty of umami and some gentle underlying fruitiness. Smooth mouthfeel with little carb. Good.
Coppery color with a small off white head. Malt and smoky flavors with some earthy woodiness. Long and drawn out, tapering finish.

Taste is reminiscent of smoked meet and olives. Opaque orange brown colour, white head, scent of peat

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A beautiful honey-colored like beer met a somewhat yellow, firm layer of foam. It has the typical aroma of smoked ingredients. It tastes somewhat sweet and the alcohol is very present, and the smoked taste remains in the background. Perfectly balanced. The somewhat sweet aftertaste doesnt last very long.

Een prachtig honingkleurig bier, met een iets gelige stevige kraag. In het aroma zit weer de sterke geur van gerookte ingrediënten. De smaak is vrij zoet en de alcohol is hier ook volop in aanwezig. De rooksmaak blijft echter op de achtergrond, maar dit maak het geheel perfect in balans. Jammer genoeg blijft de zoete nasmaak niet echt lang hangen.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2017 BOTTLE 50CL from Koelschtrinker. Clear chestnut brown, beige head. Rich heartly smoky aroma, some malts maybe. Moderate spicy smoky and hoppy bitterness, blending into o silky smooth malty body, that is neither too sweet/sugary/caramel, nor to dry or too heavy. Excellent. 7-4-7-5-15=3,8 6-JUN-2014. BOTTLE 50CL from Erzengel. BB June 2013 - sampled June 2014. Look; hazy ruby-brown with an ivory creamy head. Aroma: smoky but not bacon, some spice, olives?, some malt sweetness and breadiness in the background, Later on, you some floral hops too. Taste: smoky, green fruit acidity/funk - is it spoiled?, light bitterness

Looks like I had a bad bottle. 8-4-7-3-14=3,6

Bottled, 500ml at Schlenkerla in Bamberg. Dark amber with off white head. There is a deep smokiness to this, smoky bacon with a hint of smoked paprika, smooth and luscious, silky and full of flavour. The alcohol fills the palate, the apricot fruitiness adds character. Lovely.

500ml brown bottle. Golden pour, a good fingers worth of clingy white head in the glass. Smoke and light meat in the aroma. In the mouth the beer opens with smoke, ash, meaty notes. Some later grain notes caramel and light alcohol come later. Lovely.

Bottle. Aroma caramel, honeyish, in addition to the classic smoke. Light plum. Absolutely clear amber colour. Taste is very clean. Honeyish maltiness with some serious smoke. Strong, harmonic, showcasing all the crucial elements. Very very good.

Flasa. Tmava jantarova farba, kremova pena, rychlo upadla. Vona sladka, karamelova, udena. V chuti slad, jemne med, ovocne tony a hlavne udeniny. Telom je pivo velmi svieze, pitelne a najma vzhladom na udenost prekvapivo pitne. Moooozem to.

man this is phenomenal but I got to review this during te second intermission as its pure enjoyment and 100% worth not even bothering to review in flavour of straight up endulgence. Llems: smoothest of smooth sweet smoke, fuckloads of wood, honey, borderline meat. Etsat: quick bitterness and zip, light orange note, constant mellow smoke, pepper feel near the back end. Amazing mouthfeel. Soft oh so soft. This should be a novel. Just dont have the time. Incredible brew!

Hazy copper with half inch of tight foam. Aroma is woodsmoke and bacon. Taste adds a surprising sweetness and fruitiness. Smoke is subdued compared to their other beer but it works nicely. Hangs around in the finish to balance out the sweetness. As a doppelbock its as light and as non-sticky as Ive had. Its even refreshing in a way, at the same time as being contemplative.

Another excellent addition to the Schlenkerla lineup. Sweet malt accented with the deep smoked malts, reminiscent of smoked meats. Copper body with small creamy head, fine carbonation and lots of suspended particulates. Aroma of wood smoke (from a fire), taste comes in with sweet malt and smoked meats. Abrupt finish with some lingering smokiness. Rauchbiers are an acquired taste, but this is a fine example.

From the 550 ml. bottle. The pour is a slightly hazy medium amber with a big off-white head. Aroma of smoky goodness along with a pale malts and low to nearly untraceable hops. The body is about medium. The taste is also highly smoked with caramel malts in the mix. Like so many Aecht brews, the smokiness just blows me away.

500ml bottle pours a pale amber color with a finger of white head that leaves some decent lacing behind. Aroma is smoky with some grass and grains. Taste is malty sweet with a grassy and light spicy hop bitterness and a smoky finish. Medium bodied with decent carbonation.
bacon and smoke.. mouth has much more sweet maltiness... sweet taste with low carbs and a long smoked fleshy finish...

0.5l bottle. Clear amber body, off-white head. The aroma is mostly smoked ham but it has some caramel and bread to it. Taste of smoked ham, caramel, toast and some floral hops. You can feel the booze, thats for sure but the smoky taste overpowers it so its not disturbing at all. Another quality brew from this company.

Et særegent røyket øl med malt som er røyket over eik og ikke bøk. Det gir den er rund og balansert smak men en smak som likevel setter seg godt i ganen. Fargen er behagelig som en varm cognac og bør serveres i avrundet små stettglass. Schlenkerla Eiche lages kun for julehøytiden kan være vanskelig å oppdrive. Likevel er den tilgjengelig visse tider på året via importøren Mjød Engros. Med eik som kilde gir det ølet en mer lievel en kompleks og særegen smak, og er til tross for dobbelbokk å være ikke så tung eller for kraftig, snarere mer elegant. Den elegante stilen er gjennomgående selvom ølet inneholder hele 8%. Man kan si at dette er en helt ny type/ utgave av begrepet " røyket øl". I tillegg til egenrøket malt bruker Schlenkerla aromahumle fra Hallertau.

Draught at Bedford-Bamberg Beer Festival 2014. Perfectly clear dark gold. Smoked malt of course, but also sugarcane and a hint of orange peel. Taste is delicious: syrupy, strong and smoky. The sweetness is tempered in the finish, allowing the smokiness to assert itself. More sweet - a hint of honey? - in the aftertaste. Wow, just wow.

2013/05/07 - Pours a hazy amber colour with a small, sudsy off white head that quickly reduces to a lasting surface film. Visible suspended particulate. Aroma is wood, smoke, tobacco, herbs, caramel and roasted malts. Taste is smoke, floral hops, tobacco, herbs, roast and caramel malts. Starts off sweet and transitions to smokey, herbal and slightly bitter. Flavours are incredibly well balanced. Mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation and a mildly drying finish. Well enjoyed.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle from BierNavigatie. Clear amber brown with a medium white head. Medium to full body with moderate carbonation. A sweet brew with a lot of smoke and some herbal bitterness. Ash, wood, smoke, fruits, brown sugar, caramel and herbs. A great full flavoured smokey experience.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2014 From tap. Light brown/beige head. Very strong smokey aroma. Taste is incredibly smokey as well but not sharp or unpleasant at all. Taste of especially sausage but also lots of burnt toastiness, wood, some hops, caramel, bacon and malts. Big bodied beer indeed, with a very intense smoke flavor. I could not drink a lot of this though - a small beer is more than enough since this is so intense. Would love this for some bacon and eggs
Very strong and smoky. Maybe a pint was too much though..............................
500 ml bottle - pours a deep copper . Big campfire and sweet tobacco aromas . Smoked pork and burnt oak flavors . Complex , very good .

500mL bottle BB 7/14
Presents a thick looking bronze body with small but dense beige head.
Aroma explodes from the glass, very complex; charred wood (obviously), burnt toast, clove-like spice, sulfury smokiness, rich caramels, dark fruits.
Full bodied, quite luscious and smooth with a moderate carbonation, and tremendous length.
Offers plenty more on the palate; smoked paprika, black cardamon, heavy toasted oak barrel, tobacco, burnt caramel, treacle, clove, dried herbs. Decent bitterness, slight warming, finishes dry.
Seriously smoky stuff, but excellently balanced, and brewed. Great showcase of oak smoke malt really.

Bottle: Served in a Shaker: Forgot about this pearl:
Small creamy head on top of a clear amber colored beer.
Aromas of smoke, tobacco, smoked malts, hint of flowers, wood smoke, some plant ish tones, caramel, light marzipan and some sweeter barley malts. Nice round aroma.
Flavours of smoke, leafs, bitters, malts, some plants, some caramel, some barley malts, cream, herbs, light woody tone, some subtle different layers of smoke and green bitter tones... Easy drinker yet leaning to certain complexity. Very nice!
Aftertaste is a mix of bitters, herbals, smoke and smoked malts and some light sticky malty tones.
Low carbo, oiky silky mouthfeel, medium to full bodied and an oily texture.
What a pleasure to drink this again and keep drinking it. Marvelous beer!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Bottle.
Appearance: The body is a ruddy brownish red accompanied by a small light tan head thats incredibly bubbly.
Aroma: Big smoked meats, peppered beef jerky, and campfire with a dash of a sweet, malty, bready and fruity doppelbock beneath. Very hidden though.
Taste: The smoke is very prominent throughout, but I dont feel it out of balance. Its a huge smokiness like chewing on smoked beef jerky that lingers for minutes. The base beer hides underneath with a slight sweetness, a touch thin flavored, with a bready base.
Palate: Medium bodied and mild to moderately carbonated.
Overall: I like the smoke profile here. Keep peat smoke and ash and such out of my smoke beers! Oak or beachwood smoked only!

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv rauchig, Schinken, leicht röstmalzig, Eichenfass. Geschmack rauchig, würzig, geräucherter Schinken, klasse!

The kings of smoke. Darkish brown with a big bubbled off white head. The huge lashings of smoke and smoked food makes for an arousing aroma. Proper bloke stuff that is. Got alcohol present but that goes well in here, something medicinal about this. Prefer the urbock but this is still a good beer.

Very nicely balanced rauchbier. Doppelbock character dominates with maltiness and light alcohol, and the smoke in the flavor compliments the beers complex malt sweetness. Light amber color, crystal clear . Smoke aroma mixes with malt character in the nose, and the smoke character lasts to the end.
Tap @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Clear amber, small white head, great lacing. Aroma, malty, smoke, caramel, toffee, . Taste, smoke, malts, sweet caramel. I love the smoke.
Tap. Pours deep amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of smoke, caramel and wood. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carb. An awesome smoked.
50 cl. bottle. Dark clear golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of smoke, oak, caramel, malt and hints of alcohol.
Flaske 0,5 liter, Smagt hos Lars, god røget smag, bære dog nag af noget pølse af en art, dufter godt, men mangler lidt i smagen.

From bottle. Nice, luminescent amber brown. Small white head. Big charcoal nose. Lots of smoke. Some ash. Smells kind of like the shirt you wore next to a campfire when you smell it the next day. Taste is ash and smoke forward. Some basic maltiness. A small hint of caramel sweetness. Very interesting. Could not see myself throwing back a couple of these.
On tap at Tröls. A smoke and spicebomb this is a beer thats packing a sensoric punch, not really my cup of tea though.
Smoketastic! Rich smokey malt aroma and taste with a smooth, lightly sweet finish. Would be great on ribs.
500ml bottle. Pours a brown, red color, with a thin lacy head of white cream. Aroma is the peaty earthy smoke. Flavors are lightly sweet, earthy, and a tangy smoke. Complex and rich in character.

Dark golden brown small tan head. Aroma of wood malt and a hint of smoke. Flavor is sweet and smokey. Not that familiar oak smoke but more emphasis on the smoke. Reminiscent of bacon. Long sweet finish, smoke lingers but a a hint. Mostly malty finish. Fun tasty beer.
Bottle. Color red orange with big head. Aroma malt, wood, smoke, oak. Taste malt, wood, smoke, oak. Great as always.

Pours a nice reddish orange amber. Small head as a lacework of bubbles, mostly dissipating. Aroma finds obvious smoked malt. Campfire, sausage, some fresh wood as it warms more. Flavor is sweet. Caramel, fruity hints, campfire, cured meats, touch of earthy hops. medium body. creamy. Very smooth. Finishes with a touch of alcohol warming and some caramely sweetness creeping past the smoked malt. Touch of earthy bitterness. Pleasant lasting sweet smoked meaty flavor lingers.

smokey, ham, malt, sweet, caramel aroma. Medium body taste, very smoky, malt, sweet finish. Smookiness lingers in the background. Im not normally a huge smoke beer fan but this is pretty smooth and enjoyable. Campfire.

The oak smoke is great to pair with a steak. Nice caramel and toffee flavors balance the Hallertau hops, which come with a slight bitter just before the smoky finish. A worthy repeat for Rauchbier fans.

Um, yeah. This brewery is awesome in everything it does. The beer looks like 100 yr old cognac in the glass and tastes like smoked bbq sauce. Case closed. Aecht invented smoked beer and like the Urquell, everyone hopes to copy it.
Pours a dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, wood and of course, plenty of smoke. Taste is light to medium sweet leading to a nice smokey finish. Excellent smoked!

medium amber pour, thin light toffee head. Nose is smoked meat. Bittersweet, leaning more sweet. Slightly oily. Middle is deep sweet malt with a hint of smoke. Finish is long on the sweet and long on the smoke. Nice beer.

Flasche von Hopfen & Malz, Berlin. - Kupferrot wie 4-Minuten-Darjeelingtee, klar, kaum Schaum. - In der Nase Geräuchertes (Selchfleisch), Rosinen und milder Rauch. - Im Antrunk schwere, konzentrierte Karamelsüße, Wiener Malz, Bayrisch Blockmalz; dazu Noten von dunkler Frucht (Waldhonig, Rumtopf). Eine kräftiges aber nicht penetrantes Raucharoma durchzieht das Bier. Lt. Etikett verleiht Eichenrauchmalz diesem Bier ein weicheres und vielschichtigeres Raucharoma als das bei den anderen Schlenkerla-Rauchbieren verwendete Buchenrauchmalz. Mild rezent, weich. Fruchtig-herber, leicht holziger aromatischer Hopfen (Hallertauer) tritt harmonisch dazu. Mäßig bitterer Nachtrunk. Die 8 Prozent sind gut kaschiert. - Perfekte Harmonie von kräftiger Süße, Rauch und aromatischer Bittere, wo viele Bockbiere es nicht einmal schaffen, nur zwei davon harmonisch zu integrieren. Ähnelt von Farbe wie Hopfeneinsatz her Einbecker Urbock dunkel, ist aber weitaus komplexer und harmonischer.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 Clear amber with medium white head. Aroma of ham, sausages, sweetness. Small carbonation, taste is smoky and sweet, with medium bitterness. It is quite full bodied. Nice beer, must-try for smoked beer fans, but i enjoyed the Urbock better.
Bottle shared by my brother. Clear amber pour with a medium tan head. Aroma of firewood smoke, ham and caramel. Malty flavor with smoke and ham before an oaky finish.

My first smoke beer, bottle from Liquor Barn, not my thing. Chose to rate it against the universe, hence the low rating. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Bronze with a very clear appearance and virtually no head. Quite a wooden smoked flavour. Perhaps not everybodys taste but I really enjoyed it.

Flaske 0,5l fra NWAF Manchester. Delt med Rune under sesjon i H9 8 Mai 13. Mahognybrun. Luftig skum som varer. Litt lacing. Aroma av baconpølser. Smaken i samme gate. Veldig behagelig. Godt avrundet. Et gjennomført godt øl!

Small, just off-white head; clear chestnut-coloured beer. Overwhelming sweet-salty (= umami) smoked ham. Lapsan Souchong with syrup - not at all as Islay malt, not phenolic. Soft-sweet, with a very delicate woody-ham flavour, as honey-cure smoked ham. Finish has something (sweet-)spiced touch. Good balance! Not very well-bodied, certainly not for a Doppelbock. Very slick, even oily MF, and velvety texture. Feels a bit more carbonated than it looks. Not necessarily better than the Märzen, but certainly a worthy alternative!
Smoky malty aroma. Clear Amber with small head. Munich malt taste with smoky edge. Dry finish.

50cl bottles, Maruhn 12/2013. Doppelbock sugars fighting Rauch fighting Oak. Three powerful basic tastes more next than complexly on top of each other. Pours a much lighter than expected amber-brown with typical Bock features. Some prune liqueur and abv fumes in the nose, Basic smoked signature malts remain solidly at the bottom, owing to the bottom fermenting base of Bock, creating an honestly somewhat too traditional watery fundament for the other tastes to sit on and partly fall through. Very light-bodied for a sugary 8% Doppelbock - allowing the massive oak dryness and some smoke, salt, soy and oil to play first fiddle. Not the impressive wallop that is Urbock - conflicted at the highest level.

almost red colour, with barely any head.
aroma is smoke, ham, salmon, oak.
taste is sweeter than the other schlenkerla beers, more malty i guess. nice smoke that dries out the mouth a bit.
only thing that could be better is a fuller body

Aroma - how does one describe this aroma? Technically its chock full of beechwood and some light spice. What will you think it smells like? You might say it smells the same way you smell to others when youve been acting the Barbarian in the woods roasting barbecued meats all week by a smoky fire - alarmingly smoky, but in a pleasant way.
Appearance - body is dark amber-brown-orange color; liquid is slightly hazy; head sets up about 1/3" and is off white.
Taste - the underlying taste is sweet - what youd expect of a well made doppelbock (nice rich sugary malt), and yet you have the overtones of that beechwood - oak smoke going on. Really quite enjoyable.
Palate - body is medium; texture is slick; carbonation is soft; finish is medium in length and nice and smoky.

Dark amber body with medium creamy head. Aroma is bacon like, light smoke, really all just bacon. Taste is sweet caramel upfront with light bitterness with woody after taste. Body is medium with medium carbonation as well. I hate smoked beers, but this one is excellent.

Well, what can I say... this brew is just perfect. It can be compared to the original Schlenkerla, just without the urgent need to combine that heavy gammon taste with fresh german bread. The color is dark amber with a small frothy head. Aroma is gammon, smoke and wood. Taste starts sweet and thick with notes of, well, gammon, smoke and wood. Nice bitterness, full body.
Really the best german smoke beer. This one does not have that strange grill sausage side flavour as the other schlenkerlas. Strong heavy body and mouthfeel. Really worth trying.

500 ml. bottle. Appearance:clear, yellow, finger of white head that diminishes quickly, no lace. Aroma: smokey, glazed ham, caramel, Palate: medium body beer, oily, light carbonation, lasting smokiness. Taste: sweet, with bitter smokiness, great balance. Overall, best smoked beer I have ever had, great aroma, great balance, unique and memorable.

0,5l bottle. Dark amber with avarage frothy head. Really nice strong aroma of wood and bonfire smoke. Heavy malty sweetness mixed with smokey and bitter notes and also a bit of alcohol. Full body with oily texture. Very enjoyable smoked beer.

Belle couleur ambrée, petite mousse. Nez très bon fumé. Gout densemble bien rond de fumé, de caramel,de malt et chène. Bcp de corps, sans trop de carbonation. Fin de bouche longue et douce fumée. Super
Bottle: Brown color. Intensive aroma of ham, bacon and smoked malt. Flavor is full malty, light sweet, smokey, ham. Wonderful.
Poured a medium copper with a thick white head. Aroma of the rauched malt and light fruity notes. Medium body, the flavour is smooth and smokey,
Smells smokey,fruity and caramelly. Sweet, smoky and typically caramelly. Robust, but drinkable.
Smells like smoked ham. Has a smooth taste of oaky smoke, not as sharp as other schlenkerla?s. Body of sweet malt. Nice.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2017 I am a big fan of Schlenkerla beers and did well to intentionally save this one until I got my hands on some smoked salmon. It is a match made in heaven. Unfortunately the smoke character in this one is meager compared to the Marzen or Urbock, but still its most obvious attribute. What it lacks in smokey punch it makes up for in alcohol, which is very well hidden. Like no other doppelbock, that is for sure!

50cl butelka.
OCZY : śliczny brązowy kolor z małą pianką o cieniutkich pęcherzykach. Kolor piany jest szary.

NOS : czarna czekolada, toffi, sernik z rodzynkami, banan, drewno, alkohol i dym.

USTA : gęste piwo o mlecznej teksturze. Delikatnie gazowane. Na starcie w ustach piwo ma dosyć wyrazisty słodki smak. Szybko natomiast wyczuwa się kwaskowatość estrów. Nie jest ona przesadna i świetnie wżenia się w całość. Gorzkość nie jest intensywna ale bogata w nuty alkoholowe z dodatkiem pieprzu. Trochę przypomina syrop na kaszel w posmaku. Wędzone nuty są bardzo subtelne ; nie da się ich zapomnieć ale nie dominują smaku. 

ODCZUCIA : jest o piwo wyraźnie z "wyższej polki". Bogate ale wymagające. Alkohol jest wyraźny i rozgrzewa od środka. Nuty wędzone są faktycznie inne niż u swoich braci z tego samego browaru ; czuć jest bardziej drewno niż węgiel. Na pewno nie zawaham się spróbować to piwo ponownie. 

OCENA : 
smak : 8/10
pijalność : 5/10

Chyba jedno z najslabszych dla mnie piw z browaru Heller. Zapach dosc intensywnie wedzony, Posmak kapusty kwaszonej, jakby bigosu babcinego, wilgotna piwnica i troche trufowy smak, wedzony ale delikatny lekko miodowy, slodkawy finisz i niestety alkoholowy, szkoda ze nie dalo sie go ukryc. Kolor bursztynowy i szkoda ze z minimalna piana jak w euro lagerze. Ale intensywny zapach grilowanej karkowki nieco rekompensuje temu sezonowemu piwu.

Pours out a clear copper/amber with a thick off-white head. Lots of lacing left over. 

Smoke comes off less powerful than some of the other Schlenkerla offerings. More woody than meaty. Smoke seems a little more multifaceted than how the beechwood comes off. Sweet caramel maltiness. 

Plenty of smoke character and sweetness all over with some breadiness. 

Creamy smooth medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This version of the Bambergs smoke-beer is definitely my favorite from this brewery. Subtle smoke taste. Round sweet malt taste with a balanced spiciness. Great beer.
To me, this comes close to the Urbock version. Both are wonderful and so is the Märzen. Perfect balance with the smokiness matched by sweetness and bitterness. Complex. Easy to drink. Wonderful.

I like unique and one of a kind brews with big flavors. Even if I dont get it I total admire the ambition and risk of it. With this brew all your senses, smel and taste are engaged. The aroma is a scent of barbecue, smoky like sausages are grilling in a pit ablaze. Plum hue. Thick head. Powerful flavors, the smokiness of it lingers in your mouth. It seems more boozy than it really is. Like someone stated this is not a brew for everyone but I get it. One of the years best.

500 mL bottle from Total Wine, Virginia Beach, VA. Dark orange pour with a frothy off-white head. Powerful aroma of smoked sausage, peat, and oak. As intense as the aroma is the taste manages to be smooth while the smoke still dominates as the main feature in the flavor. The smoke blends wonderfully with elements of wheat, oak, and light toffee. This beer is certainly not for everyone but I quite enjoyed it. Sorry I waited so long to try this one but it is a winner!

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2016 Rerate: Bottle, shared with Miro B. and JFK10000. Pours deep orange, off white head. Smoke, malty, sweetish, very light. Not my favourite Schlenkerla. 

Bottle at Pivkan, Zagreb, about a year ago. Reminded me of smoked cheese. I enjoyed it, but probably not everyone will like it. 7/4/7/4/15  3.7

500 ml bottle. Pours a flaky orange amber with a short lived white head. Aroma is maple, wood, smoke. Flavor is sweet, brown sugar, cinnamon, caramel, toffee, smoke. Finish is smokey and herbal. Dry. Lingering smoke. Light to medium body, average carbonation. Solid.

What an excellent smoke aroma as well as even MORE intense smoke flavor! Moderately malty and no bitterness. The only real campfire beer I've had. I'd like to see it aged in High West Campfire Whisky barrels.
Another very nice smoked beer from Brauerei Heller! Cant say if this is better than Urbock, very good anyway.

500ml [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Head: off-white, lasting. Colour: clear orange golden. Aroma: smoked bacon, hops. Taste: smoked bacon, medium bitter-sweet. Palate: mild, medium bitter-sweet finish, low CO2. Overy: very nice.

Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with a brown head. Aroma is big smoke, ash, bbq, meaty, cheese, caramel and malts. Taste is very smokey again, moderate sweet and light bitterness. Lots of meeaty bacon, smoke in the finish. A bit too much for me but still a unique flavour.

Pours a mostly clear dark amber with a white head and decent lacing. Smells like a glazed smoked ham with some oak notes. Caramel sweet malt taste that blends with and helps to smooth out and cut the smokey flavor very nicely. Some oak flavors also and some earthy and herbal hop notes underneath it all. Finishes with a sweet smokiness and light herbal taste. Mouthfeel is soft with a light medium body and moderate carbonation. Very smooth drinking with just the right amount of smokiness. Rich, full flavors that blend very well. Would be outstanding with BBQ.

Bottle from de Bierkoning. Clear copper pour with thin white head. Aroma of nice mellow smokiness, light caramel malt, quite woody, bbq briquettes (not meaty like some of the other ones are). Taste is quite smoky, sweet, bbq, flavor is a bit meatier, more bacon notes. Palate is full bodied with low-med carbonation, coats the palate, silky. Good, but I prefer the lighter Schlenkerlas.

Bottle
Aroma-smoke, bacon, sausage
Appearance-amber, clear, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, abrupt finish
Overall-perfect
On tap. Clear deep amber with small off white head. Aroma very smoky, meats, orange and malt. Taste is heavy smoke, meat, more meat, malt, citrus with a smoky finish.

Aroma: huge amount of smoked notes, caramel (light sweet notes).
Appearance: clear amber color with thin head.
Taste: the main role is played by smoked notes - smoked cheese and meat, woody notes, sweetness, light alcoholic notes, very smooth, nice balanced.
Palate: full body and low/medium carbonation, oil texture, smoked notes and alcohol in finish.
Overall: One of the best smoked dopplebock I ve ever tried. Complex taste, nice balanced, perfect.

Bottle 0.5l from P&M Bonn. Pours a clear copper with a fast vanishing off white head. Aroma is smoked ham, burnt wood. Aroma is light bitter, medium sweet, roasted malt, oak wood, smoked meat. Full bodied and very moderate smokey aftertaste. Okay but I prefer the Urbock or Märzen. This beer is too sweet and lacks the smokey punch of a regular schlenkerla.

0,5 l bottle BB 05/14 
smoke, woody, roasty, toast, cereal, brown, clear, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, oily feel, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

amber colour, one inch dense off-white head;aroma of smoked ham and cheese, malt, maybe sourish notes; taste of smoked ham again with significant maltyness and hoppy bitterness - cool smoked beer, as always in case of Aecht Schenkerla beers

Another highly rated beer but not for me, gotta try everything I can to know whats out there though. 4 oz draft at Jester King today poured apple juice tone clear with mild carbonation and little head. Notably smokey nose, unfortunately reminded me of smoked ham which ruined the experience. Taste was better but not for me still, smokey wood/malts and more almost smoked meat flavor. Thick mouthful, dry bitter end.

.5l bottle @ Peurunka Apollo Taverna Pours clear copper with almost no head at all. Aroma is smoked pork, malts, fruits. Rubber notes? Flavor is alcohol, smoke, smoked pork, ash. Woody. Dry palate, some hops.

Clean clear amber orange brown colour. Moderate but just lasting white head. Nose has a deep roasted meaty quality wrapped in sweet smoke. Taste is superbly complex. Clean, rich tantalizingly strong but balanced smoky flavours and the oak quality and alcohol are superbly well integrated. Firm strong intricate structure. Long deep satisfying finish.
A masterpiece.

Normally dig these products, but this one wasnt great. Pour was amber brown, thin head. Aroma of smokey ash and caramel. Flavor followed, dry smokey oak, slight acidity in the finish, dry, and bitter. Meatiness was also lacking the norm from Schlenkerla. Meh.
On draft. Tremendous oaky aroma. Thin, almost absent carbonation. Sweet toffee flavor with a syrupy, sticky mouth feel. Quite an experience.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours amber copper color with minimal white lacing head and a smoked ham scent. First observations of the taste is that it has some smoked ham and wood in it, secondary tastes emerge after few sips as sweet and smoked malts, caramel, some spicyness and herbs The smokiness of Hellers rauchbiers are truly unique and thrillingly tasty. One of the best smoked style beers i have tasted.This would even work well as a breakfast in some occasions. Very tasty drink.

Bottle @ #HPJ-13. Pours a clear burnished copper with a small, white head. Aroma is smoke and smoked ham. A bit of oak perhaps as well. Taste is rather sweet. Smoke and smoked ham dominate again, but caramel is quite strong as is certain pale malt graininess. The malt base is really strong in this one in comparison to Urbock or Märzen. Some nuttiness and butteriness. Surprisingly light in the mouth, not much carbonation. A bit of a disappointment perhaps.

500ml bottle, clear deep amber colour, small frothy off-white head, not much lacing. Smoky and tarry aroma of caramel malt, fruit, herbs and even a bit of meat. Taste is bittersweet and somewhat salty initially, turning into a longish bitter finish with a moderately astringent and slightly alcoholic feel. Full body, creamy texture, average carbonation. Quite good and stands out, should certainly try out more of this style as Im into all kind of smoked things anyway.

Copper, red, caramel coloured clear beer with a small beihe head. A lovely smokey, smoked ham aroma with sweetness. Very soft mouth feel. Full body. A hint of bitterness but lots of caramel and sweetness. Very lovely taste. The bitterness actually arrives a little lately in the after taste. A very good beer!

Pours dark orange with a large light tan head. Smells strongly of smoke. Taste is strongly smokey with a little malt sweetness. Full-bodied with a smooth, slick texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Schlenkerla Eiche Doppelbock finishes with a lingering smokey sweetness.

500 ml bottle bought from "Lifesource" in Salem OR.
$5.49
Pours a hazy amber colour with a small yet very persistent off white head.
Its been a while since i had a Schlenkerla beer but the delicious smokey aromas bring me right blackened smoked ribs,sausage and ham..fantastic really cant get enough,.Yet you can get the really great malty backing if you sniff deeper.
The taste is far more balanced with the almighty chewy,caramel malts almost besting the delicious smoke.Both are melded into one by expert brewers.
Nice smooth ,creamy palate a treat for the tongue!
Just a wonderful winter beer..great stuff.

Pours a clear amber color with a quickly disappearing head. Nose has smoked meat, oak and burnt caramel. Taste is quite sweet with a long, mellow and sweet finish with a final kick of mild bitterness. Carbonation is medium and the palate rich and oily. Overall an excellent smoke beer with the high ABV well hidden.

500ml bottle from Alko. Pours darkish amber with an off-white head. Aroma of smoked malt, caramel and oak. Sweet malty and bitter wooden and hoppy flavour with smoke and slight alcohol. Pretty full-bodied with an oaken, sweet-bitter finish.

On tap at Alewife in Baltimore. Pours an amber very clear. Minimal head. Lots of smoke in the nose. Only smoke. Flavor is a burnt marshmallow cooked over a campfire. Interesting. Lots of smoke. Nice to style.

0.5 l bottle from Alko. Orange brown colour, small head. Smell and taste are dominated by smoke. Yes, the smoke is not here as aggressive as from the beech. Well, hard say to really, I should have tasted this together with the more common variant. The high amount of alcohol is still covered in smoke.
bottle, pours deep golden brown, small head, laces ok. nose is campfire, mild cigar, tabac. massive smoke attack. dry finish.
Kirkas, kuparinruskea, nopeasti häipyvä ohut vaahto. Tuoksussa savukinkkua ja tammea. Maussa maltaisuutta, tammisuutta, suolaisuutta ja ehkä hieman anistakin. Jälkimaussa alkoholin poltetta.

Bottle. Amber clear. Like all schenkerlas, a strong beech wood smoky nose. Quite clean, slight sweet, malty otherwise. Full body. Swert, slight buttery mals, some honey. Some green bitterness in finish, leaving a dry palate.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Brown with low head. Full Smoke with smoke and old cottage aroma. Bitter with spices taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: NOV 21, 2013 Tastes like your favorite burnt orange jacket stuffed with candied salmon and bacon, soaked in genever gin and then smoked over an oak campfire. One of the greats.
I liked this very much, brilliant smoked ham is all I needed. Will be pairing this with what ever is on the BBQ this coming summer.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2015 A color of clear copper; a little white head. The aroma displays well the same kind of smoked ham as the classic, Urbock. Ham is accompanied by tar and German-style bready maltiness. Initially light sweet taste turns quickly into a celebration of smoked maltiness. Smoked ham features but is countered by tar which makes this a bit different than Urbock. Stronger abv suits this beer style well. The palate is medium to full bodied and velvety smooth. It is difficult to imagine a better beer for a Christmas feast. Hard to tell which one is better, Eiche or Urbock.

Smells of smoked ham or bacon. Taste is peated whiskey & then *bam!* - astringent cardboard. Looks like I got a bad bottle of this one. Will have to get another one sometime & re-rate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pour from bottle is dark amber with a small white head. Aroma of smoked meats. Flavor is moderately sweet with a mildly bitter finish. Not particularly complex. Good carbonation.
0,5l bottle from Alko. Pours clear copper with a very low head. Aroma is smoked ham. Flavor is smoked ham, malts and some hops. Quite excellent.

500 ml bottle. Clear coppery colour, thin off-white head. The aroma is quite smoky, sweetish, with malt and notes of smoked ham. Smoky-malty, sweetish flavour, with smoked ham and hoppy notes. Some tar in the finish. Very tasty.
Bottle to tulip. Char, peat and maize. Clear chestnut with a tan head that lingers. Overt smoke pit with caramel, toffee and cracker. Alcohol shows nicely in the background.
Bottle. Clear amber color with a thin light brown head. Aroma of smoke and grain. Flavors are oak, peat and smoke. Sweet taste with some bitterness. Medium body. Oily feel. Low carbonation.
Deep clear copper with a beige head. Aroma of bacon, woodsmoke, and caramel. Tastes like caramel and smoked bacon. Medium-full bodied and pretty smooth.
from beerlicious iphone app: burnt smoke. amber and hazy with frothy white head medium sour to heavy bitter. salty full creamy with avg carb

50 cl, bottled. Pours clear ruby with a white head. Aroma: Wood smoke, oak, malt. Taste: Sweet, slight umami. Some bitterness. Minimal notes of hay. Some licorice. Palate: Near medium body, slick. Good smoked lager. Alcohol is well hidden.

Deep red colour with light head on top. Interesting smoke aroma, you can feel the oak in there. Underneath the smokiness there is sweet malt body. Taste is rather sweet, some toffee and of course lots and lots of smoke. Pretty elegant beer, but as always with smoked beer its a bit one-dimensional, but hell if its this good who cares!

Bottle. Dark amber colour, good looking. Very minimal head that also fades fast.
Sweet smoky tar, ham and bacon on aroma.
Taste is very sweet, tar, mild smoke and meat. Alcohol comes through a little.
For me, palate is weakest link here, this needs bit fuller body and more carbonation, i.e. more character.
I have tasted two different batches from bottle, and one from tap, and have to say that I was expecting little bit more from "Eiche", maybe the expectations were just too high. Good beer but I prefer Urbock.
Reddish orange clear beer with little white head. Aroma and flavor of smoked ham. Also has tar sugary sweet taste. Thick and oily palate with low carbonation. Pretty enjoyable but one-dimensional.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2015 Deep clear ruby / amber color, nice creamy off-white head that stays ok and leaves lacing also. Strong smoky aroma is pure and nuanced, malt and hops mostly stay under smoky aromas, tar, bonfire and sea come to mind. Good palate, full and round, oily, soft carbonation, great smoky flavor stays to long finish, roasted bitterness, as this gets warmer the malty base stands out more with caramel and syrup. Liked this a lot, smoky aroma and flavor done as well as I imagine it can be done, great.

(Bottle, 0.5 l - BBE 04/2014, from Alko, 20131108) The beer poured brown and clear. Its head was medium sized and almost white. Aroma had smoke, smoked ham, grilled sausage and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were smoke, tar, smoked ham, grilled sausage, malts, mildly molasses, grass and low bitterness. Aftertaste was smoky and bitter. A very smoky brew. The smokiness actually hid the rest of the beer too much.
Bottle 0.5 at home. BBE 4/2014. Colour is clear copper with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Smoke, tar, wood, some sweetness and malts.
081113. Bottle at home. Pours clear dark copper with a disappearing head. Aroma smoke, oak, Smoaky smooth taste. Very awesome. Not Bad.

Smell of smoke. Copper colour, small beige head. Aroma of smoke, oak, alcohol, tar, sugar, Sisu candies. Considerably milder smokiness than in other Schlenkerla beers. Very sweet and rather oily. Carbon is very flat.
bottle 50cl @ home. Pours clear amber with a small head. Sweet, smoky, malty aroma. Smoky, malty, a bit bitter.
Pour thanks to adnielsen. Aroma is crazy, smoked pork and molasses? Flavor is smokey and sweet, with peat and caramel. Cool
Pours a very murky brown. Smokiness prevails, but did get a metallic tang from this beer.

Picky me...adjust the temp and reduce the bottle carbonation (swirling technique) to get a perfect creamy mouth feel, the aroma is reminiscent of fresh lit cigar. The caramel color gets you prepared for a sweet mouthful, as smoky a beer as Lagavulin is peaty to Scotch. This was enjoyed with Jamaican Jerk seasoned thick cut pork chops and sweet potatoes at harvest season.

Bottle, shared with Grippitis. Deep golden hue, lasting lacy head. Sweet meaty smoke aroma, classic Bamberg all the way. The same meaty smoke character fills the palate, with sweet soft malts in support allowing hints of vanilla and light banana to peak through.These Bamberg beers are always a hit with me.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle: deep amber with a darker, copper center; hazy with only slight transparency, topped off with a beige & gray cap that has decent retention and leaves mild lacing behind. Aroma is robust smoke, smoked sausage, bacon; sweeter smoke than other Schlenkerla rauchbiers. Caramel & toffee malts are present as well. Heavy oak in the back-end. Taste is full of liquid smoke with a soft sweetness, burnt campfire wood, dry oak, light bacon-y peated malt, sweet malty caramel, toffee, & some plum-like fruitiness in the finish. Aftertaste full of smoked wood & fading caramel notes. Another very nice Schlenkera rauchbier.

Bottle from Redstone
Pours a crystal clear medium golden color with a smallish white head that dissipates to a cap. Smells of campfire, bbq chips, and a hint of alcohol. I really cant get past the smoke in the aroma. The flavor is sweet and malty deep underneath a smokey woody facade. Medium body with a moderate level of carbonation and a sweet phenolic mouthfeel. Really smokey, a bit one dimensional, but damn it was easy to enjoy.

Flasche 50cl, 4 Monate über MHD . Rotbraun, kleine Schwebeteile. Dünne Schaumdecke. Feiner Rauch überall, weniger scharf als beim Klassiker.
